comments.text: Easy ride to Alta.
Great for Hammerfest, North Cape and Alta.
I hitchhiked at the gas station exit and got a direct ride to Nordkapp early in the morning. Don't expect a lot of traffic though.
Good spot for Hammerfest or to the NorthCape :)
good place to go north or to hammerfall too
Great spot for going south to Oslo, we got a hitch to Elverum, maybe worth waiting for a longer ride?

Update: As of summer 2017 there is construction work on the E6 all the way from Trondheim and further south. There is NO space for cars to stop here but if you walk down south there will be a small dirt road that turns off the E6 where cars can stop though it's not very big. I got lucky and a lorry just stopped in the middle of the road for me.
Great spot to go south! I got picked up after only 10 minutes and dropped off in Dombas!
Statoil gas station just near the roundabout, where it is worth to go and ask the many truck drivers filling gas there. Waited 5 minutes for a truck going to Dombas.
Great spot for going west on the E39 or south on the E6. Take the bus 310, 340 or 410 and stop at Storler, it costs 50 NOK.
the other gas station in Moss sucks but from here i got a ride to Oslo almost instantly, even if theres not a lot of space. plenty of traffic.
Not much space to pull over, but not a problem at all (!), much traffic to Oslo.
Good place catch a  ride after few minutes towards Oslo
nice long road from the airport. we were picked up before we even made it the crossroad (like 5 minutes max.)
I was so lucky to get a ride in 40 seconds :-)

Gas station and restaurants, lots of people, easy to get rides anywhere South. Mosser and his three children Jacob, Maria and David, picked me up on a ride to Horten, and conversed about Norwegian social structures.
Asked around and found a car going to Stavanger after trying with 3 cars
I stood at the exit of the gas station, where the parking lot starts. Got a ride to Tonsberg in a few minutes.
Waited 15 minutes for a hitch-hike to Skien.
Gasstation by E18, the main road between Oslo and Kristiansand. This is a very good spot if you are going south!
It was quick ! Lots of cars passing by with a good spot to stop if needed
Easy to spot. Cars are coming fairly slow. Got a ride here to Fagernes in 10 mins
Hitchhiked from here twice, and never had to wait longer than 30 mins!
Walk past the roundabout and you will find a little spot for cars to pull over, so perfect location. I had to wait 15 mins for a ride to E6.
i would say not difficult to get a ride toward the directtion of Navik.
We were asking the people at the gas station and got the 6 hour ride strait to Helsingborg
look for danish plates. after few minutes of asking some couple took us to copenhagen
One minute to catch a ride to Prague for four people...
A great spot to head south. Gas station to ask people around and one direction. 15mins wait to get a ride to Sarpsborg
Good spot, driver took me to Hauklandstranda, even if she wasn't going there.
Enough space, a norwegian lady picked me up
Good spot to get into Bergen. Clear visibility and close to public transit

Got a ride all the way to Voss. Good spot. No Hut there to take cover  in case of Rain but there is an underpass.

***for Reference: I‘m a woman, mid-twenties, white. I usually use a sign. Got a ride on a Saturday afternoon.

Managed to get a ride quite quickly to the spot at Trengereid. I think this might be a better spot than the one close by. It‘s a 5 Minute walk from Arna Trainstation. Took the train from Bergen to Arna - as mentioned in the other spot.

Still a great spot, got a ride with a guy transporting a boat to Telemark (?). Don’t mind my 50min wait time - I’m a scruffy looking guy so this place is as good as they come for me. I really recommend it for going Trondheim til Oslo.
Got a ride with a crazy Tajik truck driver guy, tons of fun straight to where I wanted. A great spot to leave Trondheim as the cars drive slow, can see you from ages away and have good space to stop
Bus stop，a German picked me up:)
Nice spot for going west!

Perfect spot for going to Stavanger.
It's a bus stop - much place for cars to stop, and they're not going that fast in here as it's just after the roundabout.
Very good spot, big space for stopping.

Great spot if you want to go south. 
It took my and my friend around 5 minutes to get a ride to Sarpsborg.
Got a ride to Halden within 10 minutes.

First ride in an electric car WOOHOO!!! Very exciting. It was A BMW i3 (for those interested souls). Taken out of the city, saving the walk. Great talk with the driver about an electric future (he must get that a lot).
good spot, some guy took us to the south of trondheim
This spot is directly on the motorway. You can just walk to the spot, and people don't seem to be bothered by pedestrians on the motorway. It's sort of a bus stop, got picked up within minutes!
takes some time, but generally good spot. we hitchhiked late in te evening so maybe thats why it took so long
A nice guy going to work in Tyssedal took me to Park 1
Three girls, got a ride to Oslo, waited for only a couple of minutes, in the morning. Lots of empty cars of people who drop off their friends/family.
Asked cars on the parking lot, first one agreed to bring me close to the highway where I needed to go

I only tried this spot for ten minutes because it was raining and people were hectic. Getting a ride to Oslo should be a guarantee, so many people go there.
Going north - not sure. I'm not sure how people behave that have parked their car here long-term and go home north. That's why I went to Roald Amundsens veg a bit south, where many people theoretically ought to come by when leaving the parking lot to go on E6. 
Not sure if people being picked up from friends/family that go north would get
Bus stop, heading to Voss / Oslo
Perfect place to wait in both directions. There are bus stop on each side, cars can see you far away and have place to stop. You can also ask to drivers on the gas station.
Really great spot, I stood a bit before the bus stop to make sure cars could see me and stop at the bus stop behind me (but it’s a bit dangerous for me because I stand next to the road)
Super nice spot
Top spot! Bus stop, enough place to stop.
Perfect place, just on the E6. There is a bus stop so cars can stop. We got offered a few rides to Levanger but refused those. Later we got a ride to Steinkjer
Nice spot where car can pull over. We were standing with a Steinkjer sign and someone took us to that city. The shop on the other side of the road is closed on Sunday.
The first car stopped after only 5 minutes, but it only drove a short distance, so I had to reject it. There's plenty of room to stop. I recommend it when traveling north!

Big bustop with plenty of space to stop. Traffic is fairly fast, moderate flow that evening and visibility is OK, within 10 mins a car stopped going to kristiansund, but none to trondheim. Eventually another one to kristiansund stopped and took me over the bridge to the better spot at the rest area. For kristiansund this is great, for trondheim maybe the rest area is better, you can walk over the bridge.

Walked over the bridge to take in the view and tickle our senses after which we arrived at the bus stop and got picked up by the first car. A ride to Molde with a top man. Another ride waiting for less than a minute.
We got a ride to Utøya, with a sign for Oslo. Guy was going all the way to Sweden so could’ve got a longer one. Good place to go to Oslo since this is one of the main roads people take.
Just before the entrance to the tunnel; there´s a lot of space for the cars to stop. Got a ride with another hitchhiking couple after 10 minutes.

We got a ride to Leirvik
The ferrys cost per car, not per passanger anymore
probably the best spot I ever hitch-hiked!

This spot is excellent for heading south the Stavanger.  Waited 2-3 minutes for a direct ride to Stavanger.  NOTE: you'll need to pay for two ferries along the way.  One costs 55kr, and the other 35kr, so be prepared.
great place both for thumbing and asking people at the gas station. Got a ride to Drammen within 15 min.
Few minutes and we got car to Sandefjord.
Gas station, good for both north (Sandefjord, Oslo) and south (Kristiansand).
The free Ikea bus leaves from the train station every hour, the first one is at 10. From Ikea it´s around 2 km to get here.
To go here, take bus n°4 direction Flaktveit and stop at Gullgruven. From here it's a 20-30 minutes walk. The bus ticket is 29 NOK if you take it at the machine.

Perfect covered bus stop on the E16 to Voss and Oslo. It's quite a big walk if you took the bus from Bergen centre to Ã…sane mall, but everybody driving from Bergen and surroundings to Oslo have to pass through here. Make sure you have a big (waterproof) sign, because drivers are driving pretty fast. Waited about 20-30min for a ride to Voss in the winter.
Enough space to stop and cars are slow after the roundabout. If blocked by parking cars there are simiar spots just a bit further. Got a 1700km ride to southern Sweden.
After having wait 1h at the other spot, i waited 3mins here and was picked up by a german

I think this is the best spot to hitch out of Bodo, there is space near the road for cars to stop, visibility is not great, but after 45 minutes of waiting a Lithuanian guy picked me up and gave me a lift to Loding.
A guy and a girl on a Tuesday at noon without a sign. A lot of rather slow passage and place for cars to stop. We quickly got a ride to the ferry.
A nice bus stop to get out of town.

A guy and a girl on a Wednesday afternoon without a sign. This spot is a good gas station with food, toilet and a nice view. Two cars offered to take us to Hønefoss, but we tried to get past it due to the bad hitchmap reviews of Hønefoss. We eventually got a ride to Gol.
Lots of cars pass heading inland great space for stopping. Food and toilet accessible
Very good spot going south.
At the bus stop, much space to pull over, the cars go slowly after the roundabout, got a ride to Gøteborg/Sweden.
Go a ride all the way to Fauske after a while
Good spot, slow cars with space to pull over
Good spot for catching a ride all the way to Bergen

Good Spot. Easy to get a ride to the ferry or with a bit of Luck all the Way up to Haugesund or Bergen. Both times i hitchhiked from there i got a ride within 30-40 min. If you‘re coming from Stavanger it makes sense to take the Bus to out there.
Early morning, picked up by a norwegian man who was going to work
I think there was some driveway to pull over just beyond the junction. Traffic slowed by hill. Literally 1 min before some Chad picked me up and took me to molde
a good spot in the morning, picked up by a Norwegian lady who was going home from work
Somewhere along this road there is big space for cars to stop, good location and good visibility. Great for going south towards Mo I Rana or Sweden. Waited 15 minutes here.
Wild camping at the water side, and started early in the morning, a man from Latvia picked me up when he was going to work in Bogen
If you don’t want to stay right after the roundabout, this is a great alternative. Direction Lofoten.
Direction north (or Lofoten), just after a roundabout, there is enough space for cars to stop.
Direction north from Narvik (or Lofoten), just after a roundabout, there is enough space.

Great spot, right after the roundabout, stand on the grass and cars can see you well. Hitched here in the morning and got a ride to Henningsvaer after 30 minutes. Some people are also going in direction of Harstad. But then surfers, tourists, climbers going in direction of Lofoten.

I got very lucky, the first guy I asked was going to Dombas, 200km south of Trondheim. Otherwise i think its quite hard to get a lift here past Oslo. North of the gas station is a perfect place to camp near a freshwater lake.
First gas station out of Rygge airport in direction Oslo.
great gas station and rest area, easy ride to Oslo city!
Got all the way to Skien from here! :D
Nice spot to go south!
Waited just a minute to the airport!
Great bus stop. I got out of a car, and the next one following picked me up. Record waiting time.
Big bus stop aside the road. Got onto a truck headed to Trondheim!
Big bus stop right at the junction, excellent spot!
Kind of a shoulder to pull over, very effective going south!
Wide bus stop with shelter against the weather. I got a ride to Hammerfest after 15 minutes! Also nice to area to camp by the seaside.
Big bus stop, plenty of room to stop. Picked up after 2 minutes!
There is some room to pull over. We got a pretty good ride in 5 mins!
We got a direct ride to Å (end of Lofoten) in an hour! :)
This is the old E6. Bus stop and traffic light, so the traffic is very slow. We got picked up within 5 mins.
Waited 10 min on Friday afternoon. Nice spot
Last stop of 42 bus and then 10 min walk. There is much place for cars to stop on roadside

Dir: South. Great spot. Cars can see you coming long time from on the bridge. There's a parking here so it is easy to pull over. After nearly 2 hours in the centre somone dropped us here but then the next car came after 5 min and took us to Mo i Rana. Definitely better than the other side of the bridge.
We talked to everyone, many people were only heading to Oslo, but finally someone was heading Sweden.
Gas station directly on E18 (not clear on the map), going towards east.
Good spot as cars are slowing down. 15 minutes to get a ride to Gothenburg with a guy going to Malmo!
Continous traffic, slowly driving cars. It's easy to get a ride even to Malmo! The place is hard to approach as it surrounded with a fence.

Perfect place for going to Hvaler Island.
People are not afraid of stranger, I found a lift in less than 5 minutes.

Very good place for going to Skjaerhalen. Local people are very nice.
There is lot of people going in the shop, or you can just wait at the bus station, lot of space to stop.

A lot of cars coming from the city center and from further from the 109. Good spot to go North (stand in the middle of both lanes, there's place to be there and safe at the same time) direction Moss or E-6.
Also good going direction Sweden (Stand on the right side). Also a petrol station where you can talk with the drivers. Got a ride direct to Oslo with a sign saying "Nord E6" in 15 minutes.
we (3 boys) were heading towards stavanger. dont be shy to ask on the ferry, if you cant find someone on your ferry, wait for the next one.
Perfect place, you can try to ask for a ride to Bergen in the ferry, or if you want go to stavanger, ask at the car who wait the ferry.
Perfect spot to hicht hike up to Flatraket up to the north. I didn't waited more than two minutes and got picked up by communicative, generous people.
Departure or the ferry... very easy .I found someone in 5 min. You have a market too
Bus stop with lots of cars passing slowly

To go to Alesund or Oslo : just before the tunnel, there is a bus stop which is perfect for cars to stop. Will not for for going south because cars are already on the left side of the road. Even if you want to go on E39 and driver is going to E6 (or the opposite), you can still ask to be left some 15km further at the crossroad

This gas station is a very easy option if you're heading either north or south. The gas station is small and it is easy to see which cars go into which direction. Worked very well for me... hope for you too;-)
Good place for travelling to Bergen, there is a bus stop. It´s really busy street with usuall trafic jams, so the drivers can take a look at you carefully:-)

Difficult to find the exact spot but it was by a rest area on the E6 heading south. Seriously sound guy picked us up. Another fellow hitchhiker, took us to his home in Oslo for a great evening with conversation oozing with awesomeness. Thanks mate!

Walking on the E39 for a while because traffic was very little and wanted to stretch the legs and enjoy the sun on my face. Pleasant walk along the road. After a while just held out the thumb to cars while walking and within 10 cars a nice man took us to his house in Vinjeøra where we stayed the night. Great experiencing, eating amazing home made jams with a traditional family. Teaching us more Norwegian. Lovely people.

Heading north to Trondheim. Road was quietening down as it was getting dark. So straight out of the car that dropped me off here, lifted the hand at the first car and a lady stopped. Waited seconds. Taken to Melhus.
The first guy who stopped had already picked us up a few days before, haha! After exchanging laughter another car stopped shortly after and took us towards Vestnes.

Dropped off by previous rider as the ferry came, the cars arriving were quickly coming off the ferry so went straight to this spot and twiddled the thumb with thoughts of great success impending. Within seconds a bass vocalist on his way to a rehearsal in Ålesund came to our rescue.
Good flow of cars here, often coming in bursts when they get off the ferry. Found this ride after approximately 50 cars and 10-15 minutes of waiting.
Not a conventional hitchhike here but was very kindly offered a free ferry crossing to Vestnes after the staff recognised we were travelling around the country. Brilliant crew.
Camped the evening near the airport. Woke up to a huge stag near the tent. Walked to this spot and caught a ride back to the E39 with a lovely lady within 3 minutes.

Walking along the 322 from Valsøybotn after hiking in the mountains from Vinjeøra onwards for a number of days. It was getting dark and with not the most suitable of places to put the tent, the thumb felt restless and found himself a ride within seconds by the first car going past.

Another incredible ride with a ship captain (from the ferry line I was just on from Halsa) just finishing work and dropping us off in Kristiansund. Funny and vibrant character. 

Perhaps the 10th car to drive past. Around 3 minutes waiting.

Immediately after being dropped off by the previous ride and the moment the thumb met the air was the moment a friendly man heading west on the E39 took me towards Kristiansund.

Waiting time was around 3 seconds.
Picked up within minutes by the third car driving past.
Got offered a ride to Trondheim
The best spot in Elverum for catching a ride to Trondheim. You have a roundabout to slow the cars down, lot of space to stop at the petrol station and even the petrol station it self! :-)
It is cold here, because you are so high :)
Wait 30 min to Stryn :) Estonian TRUCK stops. :)
good spot
Very good spot towards Stavanger. There is a nice bus stop where cars drive slowly after roundabout, and you eliminate a lot of traffic going other places. Also a shop nearby!

Please add a full descriptions folks. After the school holidays which stop at beginning of august/mid august, this is a hot thing to do really. Here there might be trains but in other places you can easily get stranded.
Sarek national park
Good spot both ways. Not much traffic whole day. But people communicate and want to help.
easy
easy to get a ride to Alta
From here i get ride to Hamar for a 5 min.
Just wake up in tent at morning and people from Taiwan drop me to Dombas. :P
Bus stop. Get ride right to  Åndalsnes for 15 min. :P
Wait 30 min in Stryn direction. Picked up by French turist.
Parking for NIgardsbreen visitors. Ask people to get ride back to Gaupne. I waste 10 min to find ride back. :P
5 min. to Nigardsbreen
I cross back by fery and one woman drop me to Gaupne.
Make a sign and get ride for 15 min to Lom by Old farmer and his wife in that place. Car can stop in pocket. Road 55 very amazing and also they buy me one ice cream :P Thanxxx to them.
You can come down to Aurland back or go forward to Laerdal with perfect nature road by asking people. Just look which side they come from. I get a ride to Sogndal and it was very fast type.
Up to Aurland View point. Make a sign.
Ask to the drivers if they're going to Ålesund while there waiting for the ferry going to Vestnes.
Asking works fine :) We were 3 guys and got a direct ride to the ferry to Stavanger

Just stand here to get both cars getting out of the paid parking (they will see you while paying) and cars coming from the road on the left. A good alternative could be asking into the parking area, especially if you spot people from your nationality. A couple that was hitchhiking before us waited some 20-30 mins, but we got more luck asking some people in the parking area, less than 5 mins.
nice place to wait for a car. a big bus stop where even a truck can stop. we were heading to molde.
a huge place where to be picked up by a car in front of the railway bridge. a lot of cars on this road because of the e16 and 13 crossing. we were heading to molde.
entrance to the pathway to a 1.2 km walk to the a public log cabin you can sleep in. Just follow the signs. Beautiful views, reindeer skin/straw bed  , table, fire. GO HERE!!!
Bus stop just after the entrance, easy to go by walk since mandal, car drive slowly and can stop on the bus stop.
Bus stop on the main road to stavanger or Oslo easy to get a ride.
Very good spot on a bus stop on the top of the hill so cars drive slowly.

Good spot to Ski.
Place and good traffic.
Wait 5min.
Got my first truck in no time here
Very close to the border there is a rest stop for trucks. From there you could find a good ride. Never tried personally, though.

If you need a lift back to Stavanger after climbing Kjerag, the parking at the bottom of the mountain is quite an obvious place to ask. Most people had just got down, they might phisically recognise you or anyway be empathetic as they shared the same adventure. We got a lift immediately, but maybe is better to turn a few off 'till you get one going all the way to Stavanger, as we got a short lift from people that were going another direction at some point, and after that it became more difficult

Definitely better than the one slightly southern as road is more straight, slow, with more space to stop (and easier to spot), and less local traffic. Got a lift straight to Bergen pretty quickly after a 30 mins wasted in the other spot.

Its a bus stop called Ryen (the T-bane station Ryen is also closeby btw.). Have cover in case of rain. There is a gas station with facilities on the other side of the road in case of you need bathroom or things.
I waited 40 minutes, but I think Its pure unluckyness. The spot itself is great (enough place for cars to stop, good traffic etc).

Sense no one has placed a sensible spot within the city to HH from, this is it!  Had a sign for Nyborg (15km) and from Nyborg you can hitch a longer ride. Waited 15 minuted for a ride headed to the Ikea.

I arrived by ferry to Eidfjord and when I get off the ferry this was the first normal spot i found where cars have place to stop. Bit tricky though: first you have to climb up the small hill then climb down to this point, because it's not possible to walk on the sides of the road. For up the hill there is road, for down not. No difficulties though, don't worry.
If u get stucked here there is an empty tee-pee on the hill, quite cool, just left there seemingly belong to no one.
But the traffic is
Large truck/bus stop here, all the traffic towards Oslo passes
The third car going to Narvik stopped here!
got a ride very fast all the way to sandnes although there where not a lot of cars on the road. nice long streched road and a lot of place to stop (not traffic so it doesnt matter where you stop)
got e ride to bryne very fast. as usual in Norway...a lot of place for cars to stop
best spot ever! didn\\'t even have time to get my sign out. the lane of the roundabout is big enough for cars to stop

Dir: south. Cars have to take the ferry
here. Ask truck drivers (also small
trucks)! This way you won't have to pay
for the ferry, trucks only have to pay
for the vehicle.

This is a highly frequented gas station towards Oslo. If you hitched a ride which is not going directly to Oslo you might tell him to let you out at the Kløfta gas station. I got a ride after one minute at 10 p.m. in the dark.
Many good places all around Oppdal, both south and north
i got there and the first car stopped. lots of traffic
Padjelanta National Park
Statoil.Great spot towards Bergen.If your ride goes to Gol you better get off here!
little traffic of course but almost every car takes you...
I got a ride here after about 15mins - it was perfect as they took me all the way to Oslo. It should be just before a petrol station.
january. waited about 10 minutes and some truck driver took me to ballangen
The second car we asked agreed to take me and my girlfriend to Oslo. Very good spot, lot of traffic.
Talk too people at the Gas Station

Great spot to head towards Oslo! There's not much space for drivers to pull over, but it's wide enough for them to pull to the side and stop. It's also beneficial that there is a roundabout and drivers go slower and can take their time to think about picking you up when they see you.
One of my best hitchhiking experiences from that spot. Lady who took, offered me a place to sleep in her campervan on Fosselv Camping. She left me a keys and I could do a laundry also - just amazing
I was lazy to walk to the spots on exit from the city and I think this bus stop is good enough

One male 40+, with a sign "Oslo", one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Oslo.
A bus stop, good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. Much closer there is a petrol station, but it's on a curve with almost no space to stop, so I think this place is better and worth the extra 20 minutes walk.
I was very luck this time. I waited only 10 minutes and I got a ride straight to the Oslo centre.

One male 40+, with a sign "Stockholm", one big and one small backpacks, rainy day.
A bus stop, good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. Not very busy road, a few cars per minut.
I waited only 20 minutes. The fact that I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem helped me loooads. The lorry driver who stopy was Polish. He took me to the border, where I quicky got a ride from an anothy Polish truck driver to Stockholm. I'm not sure how long I'd have to wait if I didn't hav
Great spot, got it all! Just a shame all the drivers are Norwegian. Good possibilities here to camp down the hill in the trees if you need

The easiest is to ask on the boat!
I found fiew rides to the next town, but went with a polish truck driver for a big night ride to Oslo !
It was the only truck though
Got really lucky a Sunday at 20.00 because got a ride to Kristiansand. It's a good spot with good visibility, space for cars to stop, direct access to highway, slow speed for cars, really nice!
People going from gas station can see you perfectly, the ones on the main road go quite fast. The space to stop its okay

A guy and a girl on a Saturday afternoon without a sign. A nice spot on the way to Kristiansand with enough space on the bus stop, a lot of traffic, and cars going rather slow. We got a ride to a small village further on the road.

A guy and a girl on a Friday afternoon without a sign. The higher spots were inaccessible due to roadwork, so we walked to this one instead, which I think is for the best : there is a lot of space to stop and cars go slow because of the roundabout. There seem to be a lot of buses passing through this busstop, but we quickly got a ride to Stavanger anyway.
There was lots of cars waiting because one ferry was not working, so I asked around and managed to get a ride to Bodø.

Great visilibity and a lot place for cars to stop even for trucks. Great spot for oslo and sweden. Truck driver took me to the border.
Keep in mind that in this area theres very few cars so you can wait a while but theres no other option:)

Solo male, thumb
Big space for stopping.
A Turkish taxi driver took me to the Shell where the road turns towards E6.
good spot cars are very slow here and after couple of minutes I catch car to Otta with guy from Norway
The bus stop has plenty of space to pull over. You might consider using a sign. There’s a lot of traffic. I only got a very short ride, just enough to get out of Oslo.
some place to stop after the roundabout
a truck turning right brought me a few km south
third car picked me up, got lucky as cars drive pretty fast

The satelite image are not up to date, their are rebulding all the road in this region. This place is decent, really remote, but good if your last car stop to Lodigen and you want to continue to Narvik. 

What make it work is probably the lack of people, and the type of people, more than the classic hytchiking conditions. (Like everywhere in Lofoten, easy ride)
Good spot to head south from Alta. People can go longer distances to Finland/Sweden. Summer, male traveller
Lots of local traffic but nice for getting out the city area.
Found people driving to Trondheim in minutes.
Not so much traffic, but then a guy from Kongo, who was going fishing, he had time and took me all the way to the road that was leading to Hitra.

An older lady and her neighbour took me, at first they would’ve taken me to Orkanger, but then she invited me to stay the night at her guest room and then continue tomorrow, so that’s what I did instead.
A local guy took me to Sandvika ferjekai.
Asked around and found a man that had been married to an Estonian, so he had time and took me all the way to Furneset ferjekai.
Asked around on the ferry and got a ride to Moa, couchsurfed with them for the night and then they took me sightseeing the next day to Ålesund.
Lots of space for cars to stop. I hitchhiked onto the local bus who drove me to his last stop to Eisdal ferjekai.
Waited at the petrol station to ask people and got a ride to the border by one of the many Norwegians who prefer Swedish prices (August 2025) - had a sign with 'Sverige'
Plenty of space for cars to stop! Beautiful but of course chilly on the mountain.
Thuesday morning, decent traffic, lovely bus stop, ride in 5" to Vågåmo.
Got a ride with a Norwegian caravan.
Asked around in the gas station.
Asked around on the boat.
A Polish guy with a fancy ass blue BMW took me a bit further haha.
A bus stop.
Not a lot of traffic, mostly local, but got a ride to Florø with the first car who drove in the gas station. And the driver who took me, his friend was willing to host me for the night! Yay!
Local traffic mostly, but was good enough for me to get further.
Much space to stop

A good spot overall, has space to stop and has a little cover from the rain under the cherry stall. I got a ride with a professional driver from Lapland all the way to Bergen. He even offered me a job as a driver, as they have one car without a driver at the moment haha.
A good spot, plenty of space to stop and a gas station to ask around.
Got a lift with an older man going towards Hella.
Found a guy driving to Moi to get a bit further.
Easy place to ask drivers in August 2025
Got a ride but a short one to the motorway.
Nice grandmother from norway stopped
Perfect place and 1% of the people are very nice and helpful.
quite good spot, you can ask people in the parking as well as thumb near main road
i think its the only reasonable spot to hitchhike from ulefoss
Supermarket parking. Good place to thumb bars going south or going in or out the parking lot. Possible to ask around too.
Bus stop with shoulder, shelter, good visibility, slow cars.
We wanted to reach Lillehammer, 2 cars stopped each 30 minutes, and offered a ride to Hamar, but we wanted to go a bit further, so after 1,5h a woman offered a lift close to Lillehammer :) (couple)
Bus stop with good place to stop. Easy to get rides to Oslo center or further south the E18 (we had a sign for Asker)

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!
A norwegian man helped me out on his way to fishing
Enough space for the car to pull over, and luckily a nice norwegian girl picked me up while she was on her way to work
Not a lot of space to stop but the road has little traffic so it’s fine. There is only one highway for many kms so no need for a sign :)

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Geiranger.
A good spot. A bus stop at a small road. I had to wait for some time (45 minutes) due to a very limited traffic. 
Not many cars pass there. But I got my ride for the next ovet 50 kms.

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Otta.
A very good spot. I wasn't standing at the exit of petro station, but by the road joining the highway (close to the bridge). There was enough shoulder for cars to stop. If you moved passed the bridge, maybe the cars from the main highway could stop for you. I didn't do it, coz were I was standing it was illegal enough.
Cars go slowly and you'd be visible nicely.
In 15 minutes 3 cars stopped for me. The
I got picked up by a truck that was heading to Kristiansund. As the driver said some companies deliver regulary along the coast.
You can take the bus/train from Trondheim to get here to filter the local traffic.
This place seems good for going west.
Hitchhiked back to town after walking to the seedvault

Amazing spot because you’re right at the end of the polar bear safe zone so people feel like they have to help you. Hitchhiked twice from here, once to get to the seedvault and second going to the airport. The only problem is walking until this spot
Found a car quickly, bus stop allows cars to stop easily
Talked to cars while on the ferry. Downside is sometimes there’s not many cars so options car run out quite quickly
Asked the cars before they’d board the ferry. Got a car pretty quickly but wasn’t as lucky as on another ferry on this road
Got a ride to Gjøvik almost immediately
Got picked up by the first car, but I’ve been told there’s a lot of them going on that road, good spot to go to Stryne
wandering along road. very quickly got a lift to odda with kind english speaking tourists.

Got picked up within 5 mins after being dropped off. Didn‘t even have time to finish my sandwich. Right before a tunnel. Traffic comes on quite fast but they can see you well in advance. Spot is right after the City/Industry-Area of Heiane on the way south, so a bit less traffic but i’m guessing more likely ppl going longer distances.
Svalbard, Spitsbergen is easy. Save money and hitch from the airport. Hitch to the suburb and to Adventdalen. Ask how to avoid low risk of polar bear attack! Car rental is possible on 80km of road!
While walking towards highway we caught a ride to Bø. 10/10
big busstop outside the church with good visibility. ride to bodo in 25 mins in the evening!
Good visibility bus stop, place to stop for heading South
Very good spot, but not many cars (in the end of summer season)
Great spot, I got a ride in just a few minutes (polish truck driver), took me to Oslo
Great spot to Lofoten. There is much more space than right after the roundabout.

Walking along road thumbing as I went, picked up in half an hour, lots of tourists. Due to tunnels ahead maybe stop hiking when you find a nice spot, you can’t walk through the tunnels and as there are no settlements ahead walking brings no benefit.
Wandering along street with thumb, 2nd car stopped and took me to trolltunga village!!
Walking along the road to trolltunga with thumb. First car stopped! Lift to the car park! After hike thumbed my way back down, despite little space to stop etc.
Big bus stop plenty of space and traffic, not many busses. Ride nearly to Oslo 10 mins woo hoo!

Traffic going to Hamar, Rena, Oslo. IN case you got stuck on night or rainy weather, wait in McDonalds, which is 24/7 open. The staff there is nice, be nice to them too :) I spent a rainy cold night there till 6am and got a ride to Oslo in 45 minutes. Before it cars to Hamar and Rena stopped.
2nd card stopped and took me north for over an hour, the driver spoke minimal english but it was enough!

I was able to thumb pretty much anywhere on the nordkapp road. Even with nowhere to stop. Got picked up in 2 mins and taken south for a couple of hours! Note the hiker cabin on the other side of the lake on the OSM maps was very firmly locked as of August 2024.

At the entrance to the sideroad there is a small but doable place to pull over going south to lakslev. Good visibility, slow traffic, but not much of it. Expectations where low because of how little traffic and the bad experiances pinned further down, but aftera few smug Norwegian rejections a kind tourist stopped and I got to lakslev!
Not a perfect spot, but I got picked up by the sweetest swedish woman ever, got a ride to Dønfoss.
Loads of parking placed and buttons along this road, in one I got a ride north to the junction fast with some kind tourists. English speaking.
Sprinted off the ferry before the cars, thumb out in the space to the right. After a few rejections a G stopped and I'm on my way north!
Quick weight at the entrance for the rest area. It is so wide plenty of space to stop. Some traffic, 25min weight to get ride to next ferry. Toilets nearby, traffic slowed. Visibility good
No real place to stop but limited traffic in the evening so it didn't matter. Ride to orkanger, driver spoke english
Enough traffic, going on 855
Nice spot, going north
Easy stopping spot
Easy parking space
Good spot for cars to see you and to park. Going south on 86
Good spot for cars to stop. Going south on 86
If you want to do the bakkanosi hike you can take the bus to here and ask people at the rest area if they want to take you to the start (only 10 min drive), first people we asked took us

At the bus stop on the highway, but the cars are allowed to stop there. After spending around 4,5 hours on the ramp and the gas station nearby (fuck!) I easily got a 20 km ride to Ås.
The traffic at the highway is intensive, and the chance to be picked up is also high :)
At the bus stop, much space to pull over, the car was going to Enebak, I had to go only 9 km to Siggerud area.
At the bus stop, much space to pull over, the car was going to Drammen. Much traffic to Oslo.
no need to go all the way to the end of town, this place was completely fine to go south. good visibility and lots of place to stop
As soon as I got to the bus stop and raised my thumb the first car stopped
The main hiking path crosses the country road, however no establishments.Curvy road, drivers don't go fast. Enough space to pull over after the bridge.
Great spot for Nordkapp. Good cafe on the opposite side too. Also, great camping spot near the small river just a bit south of here.
good spot, also a gas station, if cars don´t stop on their own:D
Perfect spot, close to gas station, a perfect place for camping, bus stop - much space to pull over. May cars go to Elverum and Trysil, maybe to Trondheim road.
A good spot, not much space to pull out, but not a problem.
Late evening, convenient place, after 60 mins got a 122km ride to Trondheim. The car was going to Namsos.
Good spot to get into Oslo. Cars drive slow after the roundabout. There is a new four lane highway being planned here, that might remove this little gem in some years time.
Great spot for stop a car. There is enough space for stop because there is a bus stop. People can see you from far distance.
Direction Narvik: Parking at the side of the road just after the border. Got quick rides here jn summer and winter
Absolutelly ideal spot, traffic lights, bus stop, end of the city. 15 min walk from the metrostation Vestli. Got a lift within 1 minute to Gran. Good alternative to E6.
Excellent spot for rides north
Easy as pie to get a ride to Kongsvinger. Stand inside the roundabout.

Great view! 
Drivers from both roads see you well in advance. There's a parking bay.

Good spot to continue north on the road. We wanted to go to Brønnøysund, and old man took us to Høylandet but he was going near Brønnøysund, we didn't manage to understand well each other. Carefull, a lot of old local people that don't speak English very well...

Tried for 12min on a saturday evening, 1930 in August. For direction south the waiting time is probably 2min. I was trying to go north. The frequency was 24 cars in 10minutes. I thought this spot would make more sense, since more parking lots feed into it than the one slightly more north on Tårnvegen at the onramp. I was there too and the frequency was noticeably less. 
It would be interesting if someone tried to get a ride north from here. A friend says from Espa (50km further north) you get r

Lots of Norwegians stopped to buy buns here. They are usually going far. Should be possible to get a ride to Trondheim or Oslo. 
If you go to Trondheim, try to get a ride at least past Elverum, since there are no good spots before. 
There is much less traffic in winter. 
I waited 1min in July 2021, 27min in july 2023, 102 minutes in December 2022. 
All times I got a ride to Trondheim. That also happened two times before, not sure about the waiting time.
The only viable spot getting out of Majavatn if youre going south. There is a very beautiful beach to camp near the lake and the water is crystal clear, perfect if theres good weather.
Southbound. Huge space to pull over, there is also gas station on the other side of the road to get some water, very friendly staff.
This is the spot to get out of Mo I Rana towards the south. Good visibility and space for a car to stop near the road. Got a lift after 30 minutes to Korgen.

There is no place for cars to stop on the intersection (to Henningsvaer, south east from here) so i decided to walk to this place. Plenty of space to stop, cars see you from far away. After 30 minutes of waiting got a ride to Lenkes from a nice Norwegian guy.
Not sure if such a good spot, not that many cars. The first camper i asked took me all the way to Alta from here.
Good spot to stand, good flow of cars going relatively slow, got a ride to Kårvåg.
Good place to stand, after a roundabout, cars going slow, good flow. Got a ride to Eide. Bunnpris close by, public toilet.
A spot is right after the roundabout, enough space for a regular car, the local traffic goes to Trondheim. This is a riksveg (not a real highway), so it's not a problem to hitchhike at this spot.
At the entrance to the tunnel there is a pull over. I got a ride within minutes to notodden.
The place looks good, plenty of room to stop just after the roundabout, but everyone just goes to the next town, where I ended up getting stuck. Maybe it's better to take the train straight to Asen
a convenient spot, got a short ride out of the town.
Was waiting for 25 min, then got a short ride and then a car going 470km to Mo i Rana. The local traffic is actually filtered out, and there is enough space to stop, and you are very visible.

I've been here since this morning and the traffic was pretty heavy. There's not that much room to stop, but somehow in Norway that's not an issue! I got a lift almost immediately! I love hitchhiking in Norway!
Relativly big gas station. I found a camping-car to Trondheim in 5 minutes !
I asked for a lift on the ferry, a guy agreed and took me to Trondheim.
Going to drøbak, lot of people leaving and passing by the gaz station
Going to drøbak, lot of people leaving and passing by the gaz station
Got offered a ride by a sweet guy that saw I was a traveller

Cars slow down to go up the hill.
First car that passed me offered a 20km ride, which I declined.
Second car offered a ride to Krossen, which I accepted.
Great spot, waiting time under 5 minutes.
The Norwegians are a friendly people
Got a ride all the way to Stavanger.
This is a nice spot to collect both road's traffic towards Tromso. Also, if it is dark and you hear the howling of wolves, relax, it is just a husky farm near by! :]
Decent for traffic from the ferry

Summer/ Dir Lödingen

Good spot, alot of traffic going to Lödingen and E10
Ask people on the ferry, or cars that are queuing. Tried this twice and it worked fine
Good place to stop, bus stop, all traffic going past. Nice little rest are in the train station if you need bathroom, the gas station in front was closed though.
My favourite spot! 10 minutes wait on Saturday afternoon and a long ride to Elverum.
This time 6 minutes wait and a direct car to Sandefjord, got off in Oslo.

I followed denwers enthusistic advice and took the bus all the way here which was quite convenient and not that expensive. id you are late theres also lots of space to sleep in the area. anyways, no proplem of getting a ride far south from here, easy and comfortable

2nd day of Easter (April 2024), a 70 minutes wait and a 422km ride to Kløfta (close to Oslo).
To get there take a local train to Lundamo stasjon, this is the last station to which you use a single ticket (46 NOK) valid in transportation zone A. At that point you are well visible and right by the E6 motorway, cars go 50 km/h and there is a large shoulder for drivers to pull over. I used a sign and my thumb.
This spot is perfect because all the town and very local Trondheim-traffic is already fi
Great spot, there's plenty of space for cars to stop and fairly enough cars coming from the nearby big gas station.

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Otta.
Spots looks great. A bus stop with loads of place for cars. Cars going slowly. But there isn't much traffic. I waited 30 minutes. I got superb lucky. One driver stopped and asked me where I was going. But he wasn't going to Otta, so he left. But after a few minutes he came back and he said that he'd take half an hour longer route which goes through Otta.
There is a petrol station and some McDonald's near

A good spot if heading to Trondheim, BUT do not go closer than Elverum roundabout because there are not convenient spots before Elverum except Ånestadkrysset which is 8km before Elverum roundabout (turn to Trondheim road)
A perfect stop if you head up to Trondheim or Elverum, enough space to pull out, just after the roundabout - drivers clearly see you. There is a gaz station and a super market there.
Pretty good spot after the bridge. Might not be worth walking over from Karigasniemi though as the spots there seemed good too.
Lot of cars from Norway which were shopping in the Finland, but no one stops, saved us man from sweden during heavy rain.

Ok spot
Just before the longest car tunnel of the world 
Taken by a Brasilian who gave me chocolaté spread ☺️
Pickup driver took me almost to Bergen
It's better here, a Romanian truck driver picked me up, (my first truck in Norway)
Very good spot. A lot of space for the cars to pull over, and they go fairly slow. I needed to get to a village on the E6 close to Oppdal (Driva) and got a ride pretty quickly (20 mins).
Good place for heading towards Trondheim! Cars go 50 km/h and there is good space to stop!

The perfect, safest and convenient spot in Dombås (heading north). There is no convenient place after the roundabout in Dombås center. Take a 10 minutes walk to this convenient spot (enoug space to stop for a car) where I got a ride to Trondheim after 15 mins.
on the left turn lane, heading south. Decent amount of traffic
Heading south stopping the cars that on the onramp seemed to be the best option as there is no space to stop on the main road.

Direction south : 
I think this crossing or the petrol station ar the best places to try. Down the road, there is not much place for cars to stop.
Easy for cars to stop there. Good if you stay at the campsite and want to go southbound.
Dir: South. Super spot. A lot of traffic and easy to pull over. Much better than the hellhole called Mo i Rana.
Got a ride to the ferry, I could go to Oslo with this truck driver. Good spot, better with a sign

Direction: out of town

There's a bus stop here right on the main road from town. We heard it's pretty used by hitchhikers. It worked for us pretty well :-)
Not a good spot if you want to go north, it's a dead end.

If you stay in the car until nordkapp, as of 2024 they WILL charge you 17 NOK  (€1.50) per person in the car, on top of the car fee. If you need to avoid that, ask to get out at the nordkapp 500m sign (i have pinned this on the map too), and then walk off the road a few hundred metres to nordkapp (the terrain is fine/flat and you can see some cute reindeer). I made a beeline off trail for just east of the children of the world sculpture) and nobody cared or charged me. The visitors centre is nic

Yeah you only have to pay 17NOK if you stay in the car until the parking lot. Also make sure you leave early enough as the winds might be too crazy for camping and in the evening there's less and less cars leaving.

Update 2023
You dont have to pay anything if youre just a passager here, so you dont need to get out of the car before Nordkapp. I did so and only later found out that i couldve gone with the French caravan all the way to Nordkapp. When you want to hitch out, cars go very slow, a lot of space to stop, good spot.
If you want to go to the North Cape, make sure you get out of the car just before the toll booth. You can just walk 200 metres to the complex and save 280 NOK (!)
A nice spot
Easy to hitchin a ride!

Its possible to stand a few meters further from the spots where car can pull over, right next to the roundabout on the right side(direction traffic), In winter waited about an hour for a ride near Narvik.
waited two times here in 2011, first time i've only waited 5 minuts, second 20 minuts.
Direction South. Absolut no problems here. A lot of cars, only the weather might be a problem...

Previous driver dropped me a couple kms north up the road so I had to walk back all the way while trying to score a ride, but almost as soon as I made it to the roundabout I got a lift! Cool Tajik truck driver (again) who gave me tons of food and drove until his tachometer ran out in Støren. This is the spot to go north!

I got stuck there on a cold and rainy night. A car going to Hamar stopped, but it was not on my way. After an hour came a police car, we had a nice chat and they recommended me to wait and get warm in McDonalds, which is 24/7 open. The police was worried about me staying next to a 80-90km/h lane, which is next to the roundabout. Technically this spot is good, but the combination of darkness (there are lights there) and a Norwegian rain was not perfect in their opinion. But McDonalds was a good c

Was going to Trondheim, got a ride to Rena. 
This is a perfect spot, much traffic to Trondheim. Maybe you should wait a longer ride to Trondheim.

A perfect spot if you're heading up to Trondheim. Many cars going from Oslo to Trondheim prefer this road. The spot is good - enough space to pull out, right after roundabout, the drivers see you well.
Lot of desapointment, people don't stop for you but for the resting area, impossible to find someone going farer than Lillehamer.
Perfect spot heading north, lots of time and visibility for drivers to see you and a huge rest area for them to pull into.
Got a lift from a Tesla here!!

Spot for heading to Bergen.  Cars can't see you for a long distance ahead because of a hump in the road, but there is plenty of space for them to pull over since it's a bus stop.  Had a sign for Bergen and got a direct ride within 30 minutes.  Keep in mind you'll have to pay 55 and 35 kr for the two ferries along the way.
we were heading towards stavanger-sola airport, helpful driver stopped after about 40 minutes, seems good place because there is the bus bay where cars can stop and heavy traffic as well
Heading south, winter. Just hitchhiked directly on the main road. Cars can stop at the crossing.

Good spot plenty of space to pull in. Cars usually speed up around this poknt so maybe it would be better little back up the ride just after the turn in but it is smaller pull in. pretty easy spot to hitch from.

Lot of space, but still in the city 
Best option though
Difficult as always in Norway
54 tunels and you're in Bergen!
Fantastic spot, cars go by slowly, have plenty of space to see you and stop. Got a ride to Tyinkrysset here

A guy and a girl on a Wednesday afternoon without a sign, on our way to Bergen. A lot of cars passing by at relatively slow speed, and a large place for them to stop.
A car stopped to drive us to Hemsedal after 20min.
You can also go to Bergen by the road 7, but a local guy told us that most people use the 52, so we decided to take our chances with this one.

Waited around an hour. Very good spot for going to Nærofjorden like Flåm etc. Don’t go to the burger king on the 7 since the people take this road. We waited at burger king for long time, here there is also good place for cars to stop and they are slowing down because of the curve. We used a sign
Very good spot to catch a ride to Geiranger or Nordfjordeid lot of cars are going here

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Geiranger.
A good spot. There isn't a bus stop there. Just an entrace to a car park of some shop. There is a speed bump just meters before, so everyone goes superb slowly there. I got a ride in 20 minutes to the next town about 20 kms up the road.
People drive slow and can stop
Enough space for stopping and good visibility. (winter)
Perfect spot for all directions. First person I asked took me for a 5 hour ride to Alta. Male/summer
Good spot to ask people for all directions (Narvik, Tromsø, Sønja).
A Polish guy took me outside the city.

It was already getting dark and I was quite lucky that I found someone on the ferry that wanted to drive to Trondheim. Sometimes it makes sense to look on the license plate to see where they are from.
A good spot, lots of space for cars to stop.
Good spot, lots of space for cars to decide to stop and they see you from far away. Only downside is that some cars turn right instead of continuing on the E39

Rather small space only to stop as there is no shoulder at the onramp but cars can stop at the roundabout. Got a lift from there twice in a decent time. There are better spots down the road so having a 10/20km sign might be a good idea.
Not much space to pull over, but pretty alright, got a short ride approx. 20 km. Much traffic going south.
Super quick pickup, going north. We even got a free ride on the car ferry to Helden. Two people with backpacks!

Good spot for going anywhere. You can ask on the petrol station. We were There around 6 pm,, so it was hard to catch. One man Just took us behind the border to Sweden. There is TIR park, so good spot for solo travellers, they dont take couples.
Local person driving to work in Flåm. Stand on the small local road (not the main road).

A local person told me that this is the best place to stand to get a ride (in either direction) because local people will stop here. Wait on the small local road next to the red house (not on the main road).
A very good spot that you can reach by bus from Bergen when you want to go in the direction to Trondheim.
Lots of space for cars to stop, cars can see you standing from far away and aren’t going very fast as there is a roundabout not far away
Met a good friend because I was hitchhiking out of boredom. Eventually couchsurfed a week at his place and we drove everywhere around. Long live hitchhiking!

Very good spot for going south to Lofoten. Plenty of traffic, good visibility. Got a ride from a nice Belgian girl going to Kvalvika beach from here. There is also cover from rain, incase the weather is bad.
Probably would be better to take a ride all the way to Fauske than only few kilometers…
My favourite spot to get from Bodø towards Fauske. Cars are slow, good visibility and plenty of place to stop (bus stop). All traffic going to Fauske gets through here. About 1h walk from the port.
The bus station is a great spot because drivers which wouldn't stop at the gas station can spot you. Got a ride straight to Trondheim after 30 minutes

Nice spot, we got a ride to Trondheim in more or less a hour a Sunday morning. The lake is a good spot to camp, you can have a little shelter with a place to make fire and some toilets, 30min walk on the western side of the lake.
Waited about ten minutes here, heading north out of Voss. Bus stop here for people to stop.
First tourist car with free space will take you

Just met and other french hitchacker here while i was starting to go back south
I had to hitchhack twice here
First time i waited less than 5 mins and get a free ticket to the building st north cape
Second time i waited 1 hour and was taken by a local who was going around
Around nordkapp, i was taken only by polish people and locals from honningsvag, some people who work in Nordkapp
Great Spot for going south. The gravel bank about 40 meters down the Road is perfect for standing
Great spot for south at the junction. I just had low traffic since it was quite late so took a while to find a ride.

Summer/Dir North Cape

Got a ride after just a few minutes, lots of tourists

2nd car which stopped was going straight to trolltunga. Big bus too, ok spend and visibility. There where people and buses at the bus stop, didn’t cause me problems but would have preferred without an audience.

the spot looks very ideal but I waited for so long. everyone stopped and told me it is dangerous to hitchhiking but not driving me. Someone just bought me train ticket at the end and drove me to the train station. Maybe I wrote Bergen on my sign whish is too far from there, so no one wanted to pick me up:(
Got a straight ride to Oslo within 3 minutes. Should also work for the other directions as it's a bus stop in front of the highway entrance.
A lot of trank and I find one of them to Bergen. Very good place !
Wonderful place to hitchhike any direction. It's a bus stop (but not frequent).
Dir: South. Second car stopped, no problem.
Maybe not the best spot, but drivers certainly have a lot of visibility and space to stop, even if they’re probably Norwegian and driving a bit too fast to notice - bring a big sign.

Getting out of sandvika is pretty difficult nowadays thanks to the tunnels. Once you get to this spot, however, you can get a ride up North relatively easily. I got a ride up to Voss quite quickly once I got here

The spot is very good
And it was easier than expected to hitchhack on this road, even if the traffic is law beginning of September
Good spot to get a ride to Gjendesheim. Waited about 15 min.
Waited long time because of it was 19.00 but the spot itself its quite good, there's not much space to stop but doesn't interrupts traffic.

Nice spot for going south (Kristiansand).
This is a new (you won't find it on Google Street) roundabout exit towards Larvik (E18). We were 3 guys (!) and it took us only ~20min to catch a car.
I think it's better than the gas station if you're going south.
You can get to that spot going through the footbridge that you can find near the supermarket behind the gas station.
A guy and a girl on a Wednesday morning without a sign. There is a lot of space to stop, even though cars are going a bit fast. We got picked up quite quickly to Sandane.
Good spot to wait on the way south to Sandane. Cars have plenty of space to stop and you are visible from a distance.
Much space to pull over, many cars going to south from Outlet. I was lucky and after 5 minutes I got a ride to Copenhagen
Big service area. Good.

Should be pretty decent spot for Oslo, not that great for beyond. Not that many cars stopping at the gas station, but decent flow in the bus stop. Got a ride fast, someone who was going to the airport, so left us on a gas station in the ring road.
You should go a bit further by the bus stop, it's really a PERFECT spot for Oslo. I got a ride in 10" in a sunday evening.
good spot, you can catch cars from the ferry and some from local traffic as well

reasonable spot easily reachable on foot from where the ferry from Moss leaves you. Some car speed up, but they generally slow down at the roundabout, they can definitely see you, and there is some place to stop.
Heading north, caught a ride pretty quickly :) (couple)
There is a bus stop on the on ramp going north on the E6. Long bit of road for cars to pull over.

When you don’t have a car and going to the Lofoten, the boat is free. When almost arriving to Moskenes ask people on the ferry to hitchhike. I needed to go to Leknes and found someone who drove through
We were lucky, the first car stopped and took us to the centre.
Road in front of the ferry terminal.
Quick ride to Storlien
i once dropped a polish couple at this spot and they wrote me later, that it din`t take long to get a lift from here
This seemed the best spot to get out of Stordal. There is a round with enough space for cars to pull over.
Since end 2024 these ferries are free for people without car. I looked for a car before boarding the ferry and found one on the first try
Asked for a ride once on the ferry and found one very quick.
I asked cars that were queuing for the ferry and got a ride to Skjold
Good spot. Got a ride all the way to voss pretty quick. Before i got a ride to Voss, two more Cars stopped offering to take me the other direction at the crossroads.
Wait 5 min and i was wet under rain but lucky and get ride to Voss for 5 min.
an ideal place to HH towards Oslo.If things don't seem to well then try the turist info point&fast food place across the highway.Take rides at least to Voss on E16.

The bus stop is a nice spot to hitch-hike. We got a ride to Namsos on Sunday afternoon, the gas station was closed. If you are looking for cardboard, a grey container is behind a house on the other side of the road, it's closed but there's a hole to grab some.

There is also a petrol station.

Several cars pulled of for me and I had to reject them because I needed to go further then they were able to take me ...
Dir: North (E6). Here is a bus stop where cars can stop. You could also choose to take road 17, which is a lot slower but supposed to be very pretty
Not a bad spot, cars drive slowly, have a place where to stop.
Lots of cars, and lot's of time to stop :) got a ride immediately
Kristiansand direction. There is a bus stop with plenty of space to stop. Quite a bit of walk from the town but it's worth it.
Got a ride for 130km to the ferry. The cars go not fast and there is enough place to stop

Summer/North
Good spot right at the intersection cars are going slow and theres a place for them to stop

I with my friend were hitchhiking here for about 6 hours and then caught the car to Drammen (we were going to Oslo)
In Norway is likely to catch non-Norwegian car

There is a gas station here right by a big supermarked, the gas station is right next to E18 (major road to Oslo, Kristiansand) and it's right next to Torp Airport. So there is a lot of traffic going thru here.
Nice spot with a sheltered bus stop. The three of us waited for 15 minutes and got an amazing ride to Lillehammer.
Difficult with thumb up, nobody stopped until a man from Lithuania picked me up..
The spot is quite ok. Not much traffic (Wednesday 10am). Waited really long but I have no idea what spot would be better.
Bus stop with cover from rain, most of the people passing here are going on the E6 towards the south. After 45 minutes of waiting got a lift all the way to Lillehamer.

I took a bus from city centre (50nok) to this spot. I was lucky, my last hitchhike in Norway!!! And picked up by a smiling Syrian man.. it was really hard to hitchhike in Norway compared with other European countries, but in the end, I made it! :) thanks to those who I met;)
You must be go at the bus stop just before the entrance of e18, only 20meters to the station and you catch all the car.
Hiked towards Kristiansand, waited 20 minutes.
Gasstation and fastfood. Here you will catch the main traffic between Oslo and Kristiansand, and also to Porsgrunn/Skien.
A norwegian man piked me up~:)
Enough place for car to pull over, luckily got picked up by a Norwegian man who was going on vacation with good mood

If you´re going direction Gaupne/Sogndal, don´t stay on the bus stop right in the middle of the vilage, pass the brige and reach a strawberry farm on your right. There´s another bus stop there and more people going your way.
Early morning, picked up by a Norwegian man who was going to work, enough space to pull over
Spoke to some Lorry drivers and got a lift to Sweden. Check out the Log cabin on the hill if you need to sleep! AMAZING! (spot marked on map)
I was really lucky here, but it's a good spot, though ... you have shops and petrol stations around.

Direction: south

There's a bus stop where cars can stop for you and they are going slow here.
Waited 10 minutes before a car picked me up. Didn’t bring me very far unfortunately (about 35 km outside of Svolvær)
We got picked up after 1 hour and got almost to Tromsø
Good spot. There is also a patrol station nearby.
Bus stop.

Update 2023.

The ferry is free for walking passagers. 
You can also ask the drivers, there are many tourists returning to Europe from here, so you can catch some long rides. Payment is per car as of now (i think something like 600 NOK per car) doesnt matter how many passagers.
Caught a ride with French tourists to go to Reine
One of the cars leaving the ferry picked us up without raising a thumb (6 people).
Ferry exit.
january. took me 5 minutes to find someone going to oslo

Not an optimal spot if you are trying to go south. Good trafic but most of it local i guess. Aso right before a roundabout. Asked a driver with a swedish license plate who pulled in to get gas but he was going north.  I finally got picked up by a girl wo had some spare time and drove me to the border bc she wanted to, she was not going there . Otherwise i guess i would have stood there quite a bit longer. Maybe the on-ramp to the highway would have worked better. 

**for reference: hiked on a
A normal smaller petrol-station. You can go under the highway to get here if you are stepping off at the other side. Shop, bathroom and stuff!

Good spot to hitchhike to Ski.
Place and good traffic.
Wait 5min
Went back here for the second time. Still the feeling that car go to fast so you have to do big mouvement for them to see you far enough to pull over. But after 25min i got a 1h20 ride.
Not sure it's that great of a spot. Cars go all really fast. But I got a ride from a guy going on Trondheim, that went all the way to Asen for me. 50min
Got a ride to Stjørdal after less than a hour on a Sunday afternoon. Nice spot because lots of cars.
Waited 30 minutes and got a lift to a gas station 20km north from here.
hmm, lots of cars but a lot of local traffic. decent spot.

Good spot, stood at the Busstop Nedre Bekkelaget and got a ride to Ås really quick. I guess you could also ask ppl stopping at the gasstation nearby if they wanna take you. Only thing i would do differently is maybe see if i can get a rider further down south since leaving Ås wasn‘t super easy. 

**for reference: it was a monday around noon, i am a white woman in my mid-20ies**

Waited for 1 hour, quite some traffic but no luck I guess, not as others comment say so and not an excellent spot in my opinion. Then move on to next suggested spot 1km away and get a ride in 20mins. 
It was on Wednesday afternoon
Waited 10 minutes on a Saturday morning and got a ride all the way to Copenhagen!
Waited for about 25 minutes for a ride to Karlstad [19-7-2015]. It was a Sunday, but traffic was still good. Took the bus, same as the others.

Took the bus from Oslo Central station to Nedre Bekkelaget and stood between the bus stop and the gas station. A sign is good to have becaus cars are driving mot agains Stockholm and Göteburg. Had to wait for 50 mins, and got a ride to Sarpsborg. Wednesday morning.
A guy and a girl with a small sign on a Sunday at noon. This spot is quite good. Two people stopped in 20min, and the third one took us South of Oslo and offered us lunch !
Once again, pretty good spot to go to Oslo, not much wait. Got a ride not all the way, but easy to get rides at least to a gas station on the highway.
Bus stop, enough place to stop. Very good to go towards Oslo. Got a ride for four (4) people within 5 mins.
Not great for going towards Sweden, but you can get a ride to a difficult spot by the highway

Bus stop.
Good spot to go to the North (Oslo).
Good traffic and place.
Wait 10min.
declined 6 cars going in all sorts of different directions (i was headed to Göteborg). eventually a guy took me to the border. I reccomend a sign :)
Very good spot (around 10 am), ask the cars and they feel less inclined to tell you no. Managed to get to Sweden

I agree with everything that Derpy wrote. I stood here on a sunday in november when the sun was out. Had a sign saying Göteborg and placed myself just where the cars exited the petrol station. Two or three cars stopped and asked if I wanted to go to Ski. But as you can see on the map that's not on the highway so I kindly said no. After 1 and a half hour I took an invite to go Ås. This is a good place though. Not perfect since cars aren't always going south nor onto the highway but I think that y

Pros: easy to get to, petrol station, hitching space.
90 minutes before taking a ride only 20km down the E8. Not a lot of traffic actually goes onto the motorway here, and those that do seem to go short distances. Perhaps an on ramp closer to the city would be better?
Good spot to reach the south and then Göteborg, but very tough under the snow !

A guy and a girl on a Saturday afternoon without a sign. We only waited 1min to get a ride to a small village south of Ålesund. People on this road seem to mainly go to Nordfjordeid or further, there is enough space for cars to stop and they go quite slow due to the roundabout just before.
Good spot, lots of space for cars to stop. cars are slow because of the roundabout
The spot is good with space to park, slow traffic and visibility. In the evening despite the daylight nobody wanted to stop for some reason, eventually got a ride north.
bus stop in front of the hotel. cars go slowly because of the roundabout.

Dir: South. Spot didn't seem too bad, a big buss stop where cars could pull over if they wanted to. Our experience was that people didn't want to stop. Try to get beyond town as it is always diffuclt to get out. Some stores nearby but didn't take the time to check the dumpsters.
This is essentially a road of death because of the very few cars but some people will stop eventully :D

It took me about 90 minutes to get a ride to Honningsvåg. 
I also got offered a ride to Tromso.
Took us 20 Minutes to catch a ride to Alta

Olderfjord is a nice place to go either to Nordkapp (I went there in summer) or west to Hammerfest. There's a restaurant and a bus stop. Either way there's some space beside the road and it's enough to low traffic.
In winter I waited there for couple of hours before I got a ride, in a typical winter darkness. I would guess in summer time it is easier, with tourists roaming around. /Sigurdas
A lady offered to buy me a train ticket to Åsen but I refused and then I found a car going to Steinkjer.
Lots of traffic, but no cars stopped. I gave up and took the train north to Asen. Right by the station is a great place with plenty of room to stop!
Hitchhiked on a Sunday. Many cars passing by, got picked up after ca 2 min.
When standing at the exit from the gas station people from the gas station and the road can stop. Cars are not going to fast.
Dir: North. I waited on the opposite side of the campground. Cars go pretty fast but people in the North are nice and stop. You might try it a bit further in the city.
Direction North, same method as abstorz. Enough place to stop, but cars are going pretty fast

If you're going south, this is the point
where you should decide which way you
want to take: The E6 through Oppdal is
nicer and easier to follow, the route 3
through Elverum is boring, but faster
and trucks take this way. In Rennebu
there are several Gas stations and good
places to try hitching.

If you're going south, this is the point where you should decide which way you want to take: The E6 through Oppdal is nicer and easier to follow, the route 3 through Elverum is boring, but faster and trucks take this way. In Rennebu there are several Gas stations and good places to try hitching.
Literally first car took me
If ever, you have a roof at the bus stop (it's few meters before here)
A bit awkward to stop but otherwise perfect. Slow speeds and no local traffic.
Pretty good spot at the intersection to head north. Slow speeds, decent amount of cars.

There is a bus stop on the map, but in reality there is no bus stop on this road, so its best to wait here on this intersection, cars can pull over and stop. Was here in the morning, very little traffic but got picked up by German campers going to Honningsvag after 1 hour of waiting.
And cars go slowly since it's in the town
Lots of space, lots of cars.
not so good in the evening, but alright in the morning
caught a ride very quickly here to Otta, accros the Jotunheimen national park
not bad, Australian tourist family picked me up
Just by the campsite there´s a nice place for the drivers to pull off.
Slightly better for heading to Alta but also worked just fine for me heading south to Storslett.
Got a direct ride to Alta in a minute. Seems to be a good one.
Great spot for Alta direction.
Easy to get to Alta.
The spot doesn't look so good but worked fine for me in summer and winter. To get there just cross the bridge over the main road nearby. About 30min walk from the bridge leaving Tromsø.
Solstrand. Ok spot, better then all others probably. People can stop. A bus stops parallel to the E8 on Solstrandvegen - you just need to find a clever way to get woen from there to the street.
I stood there for 10 minutes and immediately got a ride to Alta! Not a tad smog of a place to stop, but the Norwegians are Kind and always happy to help! That's what I love about Norway!

Not too much traffic towards East even on a Friday. Not too much space to pull over. 
I got a ride in 15mins from a truck driver who just pull over in the middle of the road, since there's no traffic at all
There is virtually no space to pull over, many people go from the shop (=slowly).
I waited for a ride to go to bognes for around 30-40 minutes. It was 5pm, lots of family with kids that just finished school.
Only had to wait 5 mins to get a short ride south :)
Waiting already for 2 hours, no success.
I waited only 2 minutes this day, but I was lucky! Expect to wait one hour.
Perfect place to wait on the direction to Ålesund or Førde. Warning: there's no shelter to cover your backpack in a rainy day.
If you come here when there's not a lot of traffic on the road cars will stop just at the roundabout. Probably the best spot since there's no realy spot that offers the possibility to pull over.

This is not the best spot in the world, but definitely the best place in Tromsø.  Not much room for cars to pull over, but there is enough space.  Got a ride 100km to the E6 /E8 split towards Finland in 20 minutes.
Dir. East/South. All East going cars pass here. Not a lot of room to stop and you get a bit dirty but there are many cars and one will stop

Somehow it took us some time here and it seemed that most cars were heading to Osteröya, but then we got a ride all the way to Gol. In a desperate moment we decided to walk until after the bridge, which turned out pointles (tunnel+no place to stop).
I get ride to next point on map in Voss direction for 30 min.

If you come from Bergen, buy a bus ticket (at this moment 27 kroner for 1,5 hour) and get off somewhere here and stay in the busstop. Perfect to Gol and Oslo. Lot of traffic. There's a small covered shelter for bus-waiting, good in case of rain, and trees on the side against too much sun (luckily I had this one in 2012 may:)  The view is so beautyful that I was almost sad that I got a ride and had to leave. I waited 15 minutes to get a ride.
Quite OK, but we only got a ride until the next maked spot after the tunnel. :D
I have bad experience here cuz it was rain and i wet as hell. So i take bus to next point in Voss direction and stay under bus stop.

Direction Voss. Wikitravel recommends to take the train to Arna and wait before the tunnel. It is not possible to wait before the tunnel or on the viaduct before that, so the only option is to wait before the roundabout. You catch also traffic going on road 580 so it is a good idea to carry a sign.
A winter weekday morning: OK, not too many cars, but then we found one going all the way to Oslo
Waited for 2 hrs to get a hike to Oslo at this gas station. Another hiker was also stuck. Maybe there were too many tourists (it was during august)
Esso Gas Station.Very good for Oslo direction.If you are heading opposite direction from Oslo do not get off here and try to stay in a gas station in FlÃ¥.

I asked maybe ten to fifteen cars in the space of ten minutes and got a ride all the way to Gothenburg. Actually all the way to the door where I was going to stay for the night! It was dark, at around 5 or 6 pm in november. A lot of friendly drivers! Most of them going north this night though! Just keep asking. I would absolutely use this place again!
good place for finding rides north and south. great dumpster just behind the rema. if you take too long finding a ride though staff might ask you to leave.
A normal to larger sized petrol-station. A lot of traffic going both north and south.
Direction south : found a ride at the petrol station
Direction North, the first car stopped in the middle of the road.
Dir: South. Gas station here, you can ask Truck-Drivers.
It seems pretty good for hitchhiking, but I somehow spent a lot of time there.
big wide shoulder for parking, good visibility and easy to stop
Great visibility, plenty of space to stop, drivers not going fast, it’s got it all!

A guy and a girl on a Wednesday at noon with a small arrow sign. It's hard to get to this spot, you have to get to the other side of the road, in the gas station by bus and foot before crossing to the other side.
It looks like a bad spot from afar, but is in fact very nice, with lot of place to stop and cars going slowly before the roundabout.
Had a sight to Honefoss, this is quite a good spot if you heading north, lot of people go further than that... I made it to a town 2h North West of Oslo. Got here by bus
Not ideal, but probably the best to keep up on this road. Ride to Lom in 5"

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Geiranger.
A good spot. A bus stop at a small road. Not very busy traffic. 
I managed get a ride in 20-30 minutes to the next town, about 30 kms up the road.
A germany lady picked me up here, big space to pull over the car..

Area to stop near the E6, not the greatest place, because cars are going fast, but they can see you from far away. Saw a lot of Swedish cars while waiting. There is a gas station north from this road for north and south traffic. I was going south and decided to hitch here, waited 25 minutes before got a lift to Mo I Rana.
For direction Bergen: bus stop with good visibility and a shelter. Can be reached from the station by following the road and using the large bridge just past the Voss vandrarheim

Place itself is good, but we were unlucky this time and had to wait for 3h.
Low to moderate traffic.
Wasn't a huge amount of traffic for midday but still didn't take long t catch a ride, plent of space to pull over
Just walk a bit up the road from the intersection E8/E6. It's someone's driveway so a bit of space to stop.
