Nice spot to stand, got a ride towards the west,  good flow of cars going quite slowly :) 4km up the mountain theres a nice cabin to sleep in with a nice view over the valley :)

Really good spot to stand, good flow of cars which are driving slow, small parking lot for them to hold. Theres a store nearby and a really nice hut 4km up the mountain where you can sleep and have a nice view over the valley :)
Got a ride quickly, going south. Good flow of cars, going relatively slow, and quite some space for them to stop. :)
Got a short ride to Sel, good spot to stand, the cars have space to hold and are going slow, also steady flow of cars. :)
Excellent spot to get out of the airport and towards Oslo. I did this twice, first 10.2017 and 03.2018. 20 mins and 10 mins waiting.
walk out from the terminals to the exit of the garages. i bet every car goes to oslo. tried once, but waited less than 2 mins.
indeed a good spot to hitchhike not that far from oslo (took the bus from the central station to nordstrand and waited for 12min not more) 22/01/2018
This is a short walk from Nordstrand station, which is one stop from Central on the train (25kr). There's a traffic light and a driveway to pull over in. I waited less than a minute here.

Indeed a good spot to stand. Good spot for car to pull by. Waited 20 mins then got a ride to Sarpsborg. (N.B. Don't drop off at Sarpsborg if you intent to go south cuz it's a dead end for hitchhike out)
There is a traffic light and bus stop, with plenty of traffic going south and towards Stockholm. A sign helps.
Great spots (bus stops) all along the E6 in direction North/the airport. Close to the airport there is a nice little forest that you can camp in if you have an early/late flight
This is a nice spot for going to the North  you can either walk here or just get a ride before in the city at some roundabout earlier :)

Summer/Dir North
Some small shops around where cars can stop

Summer/dir North
Huge parkinglot where cars can stop! Cars are going slow and its good visibility!
Regular gas station. Lots of hikers.
Cars are not too fast. Good spot.
There is a bus stop, where cars can stop. I used this pot to get out of town.
Only and best spot in direction North Cape.
Perfect to get further in direction North Cape.
There is a small lay-in where cars can pull over. Good spot!
A good spot (bus stop) for hitching towards Flekkefjord.
Bus stop for hitching north.
Very nice spot to go south! A truck took me a long way south!
Nice spot, not-so-heavy traffic though.
10 minutes to get a ride south!
Not the best spot, but people still stop. Just be patient, be funny and have a Norwegian flag with you!
Was going north to Otta. And there where no good spots by Tretten where i got a hitch, Walked up here where it was a bus stop both ways and 5 minutes with my thump i got a hitch the whole way.
Very quite town, we waited an hour to get to Trondheim. Expect few cars.
Nice spot on E6, we waited 10 mins! Going north.
We waited under the overpass right on the shoulder of E6 :) plenty of cars in this area.
A tourist spot called Helvete. Many German campers come here from Lillehammer and turns when they have seen it. So a good place to get down to the E6.
A big pocket for going south towards Lillehammer/Oslo . Cars where going fast but they see you for a long time. And it took me under 30 min to get a ride.

Dir: South. Not the gratest place to pull over when going South, but a lot of people are going that way. Shouldn't be too hard hitching a ride to Narvik. Coop dumpsters were not too satisfying but had some animal products.

Good if you plan to go to Narvik, many cars going there but not further, waited a day and a half for a further ride and then decided to go to the border with Sweden for a faster way to get south. Dumpsters by Rema next to the Shell petrol station up the roundabout are packed with food, If you need a place to spend the night there is the church doorstep with a little roof, no one can see you except when they pass right next to it (very unlikely because its up in a small hill) plus it has a great
Lots of Space on the roundabout, tried in the diection of Bergen.
Very little space, but not a lot of traffic and the cars aren´t going very fast.
A covered bus stop, both directions.
A bus stop right in front of Rema 1000.
Going towards Sogndal. The only Space for the car to stop is a turning to the right into a minor, not so much used road. There´s also an old petrol station nearby if you have to escape the rain.
To get rides towards Sogndal, there´s a bus stop right after a huge White house on the right.
We reached it from the airport, around 8 km. Enough Space for the cars to stop. Managed to get a ride to Hamar.
I hitchhiked here in the winter after the roundabout the spot is okay in like half an hour an hour a car stopped for a ride until Skaidi
I was here in April and hhed the snowplow to the North Cape :D
Got picked up by truck, brought me to Oslo.
Direction Kaupanger/Bergen, Gol/Oslo, Fagernes/Ardal. Now there is a round about, don't know how it looks like now but in april 2014 is was under construction and enough place to stop.

It's a good spot if you travel either West or East. There is enough space for the car to pull over. Thing is, that you just have the traffic which comes from Gol but not the main traffic which comes from oslo or geilo. but it still worked very well... didn't take long to catch a ride to geilo
Good place if you Hitchhike in direction Gol. There is a round about right before and also some space for the cars to pull over.

Good spot if you travel West. You might even catch a ride in direction Oslo... but then i guess the gas station would be a better call. There is a bus lane, so cars can stop easily. due to the round about the traffic is pretty slow. Pretty gooood;-)
Not a bad place to get a ride in the direction of the ferry to Preikestolen. Not so much traffic, but didn't take too long to get a ride to the ferry terminal.
There are a lot of car . Sometruck but it is a good place because it is a bus stop and no fast road. Transport can stop easily to take you.

Many hikers hitchhike the last part between Tyssedal and the start to Trolltunga, so despite the little traffic, it should be possible to catch a ride.
After the hike, you can catch a ride back from the parking.
bad, but nothing is unpossible. i was waiting just for 5minutes and a old man driven me to the parking place where is the start to going to trolltunga
I got a ride to Mo i Rana from here

If you are so luck as me I waited only 5 minutes at 5am in the morning and the first car stop after 2 min was going only 25 km, but the second one I get lift until Trondheim (almost 1000 km lift) I think this is like a movie but you can try your luck. they are a lot of truck in the gas station going south and north. is worth the place. good luck.
South Direction. Bus stop. Fairly low speed. I got a ride in 10 mins to Flekkefjord.
Bus stop.

From Bodö to Fauske or Kystriksvegn 17. Get the local train to Mörkved or local bus (i think it was 1 or 2 but do double-check) . The university is near so if you ask near university Mörkved its fine. Find a place near the road, there are many busstops along the road. But I advice you to get here first instead of wasting loads of time further into the centre. I got a lift to Löding pretty easily.
Hitchhiked to oslo on a Sunday afternoon. After 5 min someone stopped and took me all the way to Oslo. Probably easier going on a Sunday or Friday than during the week.
Getting out of trondheim sucks - but here somebody picked me up after a while and took me further south from whereon everything went fine.
to Bodo
Direction Harstad. Not a lot of space to pull over.
Crossroads - Henningsvaer.
Bus stop.
Crossroads.
Parking lot at the entrance to Rago NP. Couple of tourists coming and leaving every now and then.
Right before the gas station you can try to catch towards both north and south.
A spot where from you can get south or north, as there is nowhere else to go from this small town :). The second car was the one that stopped towards Kristiansand.
Good spot here (direction south), people communicate, drive slowly.
its easy to get a ride to Tromso, but maybe just because there are many people go vacation at this time, the traffic is quite loads
1 hour to Gudvangen by nice English man. Cheers!
Make a sign and get ride for 15 min to Lom by Old farmer and his wife in that place. Car can stop in pocket. Road 55 very amazing and also they buy me one ice cream :P Thanxxx to them.

Every car on this road is going to Sweden, mainly norwegians who is going shopping in Strömstad. 
Got a ride after 20 min to Strömstad.
A bus stop to wait if you're going to Trondheim.
Plenty of space for cars to stop
Bus stop to wait on the way south-east to Sogndal.
Nice place to hitchhike, as usual in such a region - low ammount of cars. A needed a ride to odda better to say to tyssedal for going to trolltunga ;)
There's a camping just below, in case you need a drink !
Good spot to wait on the direction to Åndalsnes. There is a shelter in case of rain.
Good place to wait on the way to Ålesund. Cars can stop on the wayside.
Not many cars in both directions, because it was off-season. but it took us only 10 Minutes to catch a ride to Honningsvag
a bus stop right after the roundabout. great place to hitchhike.

we were on our way to odda. great place to wait for a car. straight road, many many cars going slowly by, bus stop with enough space. i have no idea why no one picked us up for 3 hours that day. after all a bus picked us up and took us for about 20 km.
heading to the west coast. a lots of cars go through this roundabout. enough space for you and car to stop.
Car drive slowly for take the roundtop, only 3 direction haugesund, stavanger or Bergen, you just need choise your road and wait after the round.
In a middle of nowhere but a large bus stop and it's a main road to Oslo or kristiansand with a lot of trafic.
Very good place where the roads between the new bridge and the village are join together. very slow and a lot of space to stop. normaly short lift but you can get even more I think so.
First good spot after Tyssedal because of the tunnels before (you make pass it a different route). Good spot toward North.

Good spot to stop the cars.
Place and good traffic.
Wait 15min

Good spot to Moss (swimming in the sea)
Wait 20min.
Enough place to stop the car and good traffic

Direction: both south & north

Here's a roundabout which slows down the cars and bus stops on both sides of it with lot of space to pull off and very useful in case of rain - which is pretty common here.
I was incredibly lucky during the rush hour (cca. 4pm) and after just 10 min Romanian truck driver stopped for me in the traffic jam and took me all the way to Oslo :-)

Direction: both Oslo and Stavanger

There is a roundabout which slows down the cars and bus stops on both sides of it where there is enough space to pull off and they can also help you in case of rain.
Waited 15 minutes here on a sunday afternoon, and got a direct hike to Oslo.
Nice place to hitch-hike out of Skien, north towards Oslo. Gasstation, close to public transport, (Skien stasjon), and by the main road going north.
Easter time - lot of cars but none stopping ... and then I got a ride to Oslo exactly there where I needed :-)

Direction: south & north

There's a petrol and bus station ... lot of space for cars to stop and they are driving slowly here.

Direction: north

Here is a lot of space for drivers to pull off ...

Just before the tunnel there is place for the cars to stop. We got a 50 km ride on direction E6 quite easily. All the people coming from the airport are passing through here. I guess you could hitchhike easily also to reach the city centerif you are staying on this side of the city.
I like the roads there. In winter there were almost no cars, nonetheless, the first or the second passing by stopped without me having even risen a hand (I was slowly walking to the South).
I like the roads there. In winter there were almost no cars, nonetheless, the first or the second passing by stopped without me having even risen a hand (I was slowly walking to the South). /Sigurdas

The place itself is quite good to go in direction of Stavanger. There is a bus stop and a few hundreds meters before even a petrol station (I recommend staying close to the junction though, to get also the traffic coming from the other direction and turning your direction). It was a bit difficult to get a lift, not due to the location itself but maybe to bad luck and not-willing-to-help drivers,  but still is a better place than the one few kms east as it filters out most of the local traffic.

we hiked from here to Lauvvik and got a ride after 15 minutes, it's a bus stop on Skippergatta with good visibility and medium traffic but some of the cars from Sandnes drive to major road 13 (National Tourist Route)
bus stop, we hiked from here to Sandnes and got a ride after 20-25 minutes, good visibility, perfect place to stop because there is a bus bay
There are a few good spots along the road if you are going north. I was there on a day when there was a biking competition so traffic was very limited.

Rest stop for trucks and cars. There are a few routes one can take between Oslo and Bergen. Some drivers take road 50, others road 7, so I waited here in the direction of Bergen. Had to wait for a long time though - more than one hour.
You may find yourself being left in Hesseng if you have just crossed in from Russia. This spot is good for getting rides further along the E6.
Larger bus stop. All traffic from Hønefoss towards Oslo passes here. Locals meet here to ride with buddies. Less long-distance/trucker traffic than on the highway below.
nice roundabout with enough space for a car to stop (even a truck did) though there is a gas station mutch closer to town wich would have worked just fine as well.
spot on a highway. we did have no other option. there is a wide roadside so it\\'s not that bad.
Dir: South. This place is called Stokmarknes, not Hadsel! Good place to go South, Coffee and Bathroom in the hospital
Somewhere here i was standing at a bus station early in the morning, did not have to wait long, even though there were few cars.
Dir: North. This is maybe still the best place, even though I waited forever without success. I guess in the summer your chances are higher, due to tourists.
Dir: North. Cars do go fast, but they can see you fairly well and I didn't wait long.
Quite far from the city center, but a good spot. It's easy to stop and there's not too many cars.
Direction North. Somewhere here, at a gas station. Good place to wait and enough cars. Not so difficult.
Direction South. Not that easy, cars have to turn to the left, there is a parking lot / bus stop. But quite much traffic. Didn't took long. Plus a great view into the Fjords
First on ramp after tunnel. Not a lot of traffic, but easy to place yourself and plenty of room to stop. Easy to get to Vestby gas stations.
Popular gas station for cars and trucks going to Sweden. Ask around and in a few minutes you'll be on your way.

I stood here for about 30 min and got a ride with a guy who was going to Sandvika, He was nice enough to drive to Asker and dropped me off at a gas station by E18. The second person I asked there gave me a ride to my final destination in TÃ¸nsberg:)
The second person I asked gave me a ride to my final destination in TÃ¸nsberg.
I went into KlÃ¸fta (after standing at the on-ramp for a while) and a truck came by (from a industrial zone). Nice trip!
A good spot (Statoil petrol Station), where trucks and cars are driving south and/or north. I just the first guy I met and got a hike to Hamar (50 km North)

Shell Gas Station.That won't take you long to get a ride towards Oslo from this spot.You may eighter go for a straight shot or try to get yourself till Hemsedalen.Short waiting time even in the winter.
Statoil Gas Station.it is not very hard towards Oslo with a bit luck.

Very good spot for hiking north on the E39, to FÃ¸rde, Ã…lesund and Trondheim. It's passed a big roundabout and a parking lot; there is a nice covered bus stop and place for cars to pull over to go to Hjelle Bakeri.

Just off the road here is the free (for walk-on passangers) Ferry across the water to Rissa. There is a bus stop here where drivers can safely pull off. It is good for catching drivers just off the ferry.  We (group of 3) got a ride in 30 min South to the motorway.
Expect low traffic on this road, really lonely but great experience to go that way to Umea
Low traffic but I just waited on the exit from parking and it worked.

45 minutes on a sunday afternoon, I never wait that long usually. But the spot issue good. I took a just a 20 minutes ride to the military zone, cuz I was freezing. Then I get mire lucky and find one quicker.
Lazy to ask people so i stayed there and did not wait this long to find a ride directly to where i wanted in Sweden
A guy and a girl on a Saturday afternoon without a sign. Not a lot of traffic, but enough place to stop, and good view all around. We got a ride to Kristiansand in a few minutes.

A guy and a girl on a Saturday afternoon without a sign. This bus spot is good to go south, not a lot of traffic, and cars go rather fast, but there is space to stop, and the landscape around is beautiful!

A guy and a girl on a Friday at noon, with a sign. This spot is good if you get stranded in the area : cars don't go fast and there is enough space to stop. But a lot of people only go to Stavanger. Two cars stopped and the last one took us to Forus, south of Stavanger, but we got stranded there so, if you can, try to have ride further, like Ålgård.
There is nothing here (0 small shops), just small space to stop.

A guy and a girl on a Thursday afternoon without a sign. There is a bus stop large enough for cars to stop and a small road entrance after the bus. There is a lot of passage, and cars don't go that fast. We got a ride to Bergen after a short wait.
A guy and a girl on a Thursday morning without a sign. There is place for cars to stop, and a lot of cars passing by, a bit quickly. We were picked up by two people who dropped us outside of Skei.
Bit scuffed but cars can pull into the gas station. Worked for me and got a ride for like 350km so i wont complain

Classic roundabout, not much space but ok
Hitchhacking right in the roudabout
To go to the main road

For me it was ok, to go back from the Saltsraumen maelstrom to the main road
There is a bus stop, visibility ok but not perfect.

A guy and a girl on a Monday at noon without a sign. This spot is good to go to Ålesund : people going through this road seem to mainly take the ferry. There is enough place to stop and some traffic, but cars go a bit fast here.

A guy and a girl on a Thursday afternoon without a sign. This spot has plenty of space to stop, but there are not so many people passing through.
A nice farmer got us to Sogndal and showed us a good spot to camp there.

A guy and a girl on a Thursday at noon without a sign. The spot is not so bad, but the cars go a bit fast and there is not so much place to stop for this speed.
Yet a farmer from Tuv picked us and brought us to a better spot in Tuv, where everyone is going west.
Very busy and trafficked spot, no trucks stopped. It was suggested to us by a local
Very good spot to spend the night and to hitchhike, although the bar is an expensive one.
Two Gas stations
better spot than gas station but it's on highway and cars don't have enough space to stop
Very good space for stopping and much traffic.
little traffic, third car took me while walking
Taking while walking down the road
Only little place to stop after the roundabout, still got a direct lift to thw beginning of Lofoten

I hitchyke on this road 3 time at different spot, between moskanes and reine, between reine and the coop. Sometimes there is no hiking trail at all. And Hitchyking works really well, with locals or tourist, in 5" you get a ride.
Not too much traffic, but got a ride to Orkanger.
Got a ride with locals to Dyrøy ferjekai and they offered to pick me up after a hike on the island and that I could stay at their cottage for the night and continue hitchhiking to Trondheim tomorrow.

Not too good of a bus stop, as they drive by quite fast, but a local took me, he was a big fan of the Baltics, showed me around in Kristiansund, and invited me back to stay with his family when I come back and took me to the ferjekai to Tustna.
Got a ride with my friends in the back of a truck, horrible weather, great people!
Big space on the side for cars to stop, all traffic towards Sweden going through. Also a tiny little cafe.

Little rest stop with bathrooms. Not many cars stopping, so we chose to stay in the entrance with an Oslo sign. Pretty soon a truck driver stopped and took us past Oslo. Four stars because they do go quite fast, and almost nobody stope in the rest stop. But even with rain and bad weather we got lucky.
First car stopped in an August morning (not much traffic here and the car had to turn around so it was slow)
It seems to be a good spot for any direction but mostly people who stopped here were driving to Bergen. But I found a woman driving past Knarvik eventually.

A good spot in the sense that there’s lots of traffic and plenty of space where to stop. But, the traffic is moving rather fast and people were not very eager to stop there. A lady saw me and then drove back and came to pick me up.
Cars going in different directions here but slow enough to stop
Waited here on a Monday morning in August - got picked up by a car with a local hitchhiker :)
Not much traffic stopping here, but asked around and found a family going to Sandnes.

A lot of traffic. At one side a McDonald's, gas station, gas station for trucks, Tesla loading station, restaurant.
At te other side of the motorway is a parking place for trucks, as they told me there is even a shower. Asking there for a lift is worth a try. Side with restaurants is busy. I had to ask around a lot though until I got a ride.

The spot is not the best. Norwegian people will pass you but fortunately there are also a few nice people from eastern Europe. They picked me up because they are more helpful more hospitable and they are not afraid without reason like Norwegians 🙄
There is no better place. The people are the problem. No helpfulness, no hospitality, only dismissive, uninterested and snide looks.
a lot of traffic, maybe even too much

Rest stop with bathroom and picnic tables. Not many people stopping, but easy to talk to them and get a ride to Rødberg. An old couple picked me up in the morning, going on their yearly retreat to their cabin. Showed me the 800 y.o. beautiful wooden church in the area, and explained the history of the water turbine.
Good visibility, and space to stop.

Less and less traffic as you follow this road. Local mostly. Town jumping. I wanted to find a nice place to camp near the river and this guy recommended me a very cute spot. Amazing river, recommend going for a swim.

Big bus stop with space to stop, and a speed bump just before that makes the cars go slow. If you're trying to go north, keep in mind most of the traffic is local and you'll be getting small rides town to town. A guy from Eritrea, working in healthcare, picked me up and took me to Lampeland.

Small, chill, rest place with a small restaurant. Not a lot of traffic, but asking people will get you places, easy to get to Drammen or Oslo. An old guy alone in his camper, going all the way north, picked me up.
Rest area. We thumped from the point where the entry lane starts. Cars rather fast but good visibility and entry round is pretty long thus easy for cars to pull over.
Walked here from Steinkjer as there didn't seem to be a good spot. Rest area with toilets. First person I asked gave a ride.
Visibility ok, lots of space to stop. Lake nearby, nice place for rest and camping.
Good visibility, slow cars, easy to stop. Petrol station nearby if you fell like asking people.
town and ferry from Lofoten only arrives two times per day.
cars are slow and enough space to stop
Just after the roundabout, enough space to stop.
Another nice old couple, offered me a ride at the gas station as soon as the last car dropped me off
Not many traffic, waited until a sweden man picked me up:)
Early morning, just give it a try , a Norwegian woman who sent her daughter to airport piked me up when she was going back to home
there is enough space for car to pull over, a man from Czech picked me up to Reine
Small space, but A nice Germany couple helped me out when they finished filling the petrol maybe

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Geiranger.
A good spot. A bus stop at a small road. It was evening, hence the traffic was quite small. But I managed get a ride in 20-30 minutes to the next town, about 30 kms up the road.
2 turkish guys picked us up and got us all the way up to kristiansund
Were walging to ringvål to hitch onto the e39 to kristiansund, got pikkedonker up bij a Lively lady who brouwt us to buvika to the onramp
Most of the cars driving in the direction to Oslo only a few south.
During the daytime, was quite okay. The success rate is higher when you ask the cars directly. Went direction Oslo so that might help
Really good spot, found a car who took pity for me and they helped me get into the centrum (at night, around 7-8 pm)
Found a car quite quickly. Downside is some cars might get off of the E39 when in the village
Asked around and quickly got a car. There’s not many people, which can be an advantage because people could feel inclined to help you out (because they’d feel bad leaving you there)
Managed to get out of the city quite quickly, people were very friendly
Waited 20 minutes before a car took me out of Bergen
Good spot to ask people in the queue to the ferry or on the ferry if they can give you a ride. Gotta be comfortable w/approaching ppl tho.
Stand just before the crosswalk, cars go slow.

A good busstop with plenty of space, slowish traffic and strong visibility. All the traffic here is going far, unlike further in busstops which are 90% local. I kinda hate this place though, I got stranded here overnight and it was raining, a lot of cars would drive past and smile and laugh at me in the rain. Don’t smile and wave at me when your driving past in your nice empty SUV while I’m freezing my tits off in the thunderstorm you giant knob. Could have been random through, hopefully it work
Managed to miss the traffic exiting the ferry (free for foot passengers), but I quickly got picked up by some other legend for a short distance, just by wandering along the empty road with thumb

Bus stop shortly after a roundabout. 
There is also a little bay after the second roundabout directly in front of the tunnel that could also work as an alternative.

Decently visited gas station in peak tourist season. Standing at the entrance also gives passing cars a chance to see you and stop at the station. Could also be used for going west, about half the cars who went to the station were heading west.
Direction: Finland. I stood in the middle of the 2 ramps on the gravel and got a ride very quickly. Amazing views too.

Ha ha ha, what should I say, guys? Last time I wrote that this spot is not convenient, and the next time after 20 mins wait (around 7.45 pm) a car from the main road pulled over. The car was going to Trondheim, my final destination. 
Maybe I was lucky that day. But as an experienced hitch-hiker I would technically avoid this spot. I suggest Elverum roundabout which is more convenient and all the traffic is the same.

Not a perfect spot because the road goes downhill, trucks can't stop there, but good enough - there is enough space to pull out for a regular car. 43 mins wait and a 280km ride to Dal close to the Oslo airport. Nothing to complain.
There are many gaz stations and supermarkets there.
A great spot to get south from Hamar. Just stand in the roundabout before the onramp, there are just a little space for a car to stop, so get ready to get in quickly.
Heading south. Good visibility and plenty of place to stop (bus stop). (winter)
The spots to stand at the road arent as good, but asking at the gasstation worked really well for me, got a ride with a truck to Kaamanen :)
Good flow of cars, good place for them to stop, going slowly because of the roundabout, gasstation closeby. Got a ride to Røssvoll :)
Going East. Not the best stop, but there's a junction for cars to safely pull over and the cars are still driving pretty slow. They can see you from afar. Worked out for me.
Bus stop, so there's plenty of space for cars to stop
Good spot for going south, busstop so there is plenty of space for cars to stop. Not too much traffic, but also not isolatet.

Stop is not perfect but I got lucky after about 15 min and got a ride to oppdal witch was perfect because I wanted to get to trondheim. Also it was possible to dumpster dive the joker by the roundabout.
There is a big busstop behind for cars to stop easily.

Good spot to go east. We wanted to go to the free ferry at Stokkvågen and it worked ! With a Stokkvågen sign we waited 30min to get a ride to the harbour and then we took the free boat to Lovund, I really recommend this island if you like birds or hiking!
Good spot. People are going north or to the E6. We got a ride to the E6.
Good spot to stand and good flow of traffic, the cars are going a bit fast tho, got a ride straight to Oslo.

We went to Haugestua Station by train L 1 and than 2 min walk to the gas station from where there is much trafik on to the e6 in direction north, second car stopped we got very lucky, got dropped of in jessheim nord where we wait for one hour ( Norway sucks)
When 2023 flooded Norway, many drivers drove through Sweden to get north.
Big Busstop to stand, good flow of trafic a little fast tho. Got a ride to Gjøvik :)

Dir: north, summer.
Bus stop so enough space to pull over, cars going slower as it's through a town, decent visibility.

Pretty good spot for heading north on the e39, it's a bus stop, so lots of room for people to pull over, and a long road so they can see you from a ways off. Got a ride all the way to ålesund from a boat captain heading home from a stint at sea. Lots of construction further up the road so a fair walk to get there though (July 2023)
Good spot, decent traffic towards Stavanger, but I guess hitchiking died down a bit nowadays. We were very lucky to get a hitch all the way to Stavanger.
Good spot to stand, good flow of cars,going north got a ride for 70km :)
Going towards Oslo: Lots of cars, and they are driving pretty slow. Good space to stop. Got a ride to Grimstad after 15 minutes :)
Not much room to pull over, but i got a ride to asker pretty quickly.
Holding a sign reading Oslo, steadt trafic, I said yes to a ride to sandvika which was a mistake, sandvika is impossible.
I was simply walking with my sign held on my side, trying to get to a spot a bit further down the road, when a driver picked me up and brought me to Rjukan
I was offered a ride into town, and also a few hours further west, seems to be a decent spot.
Was heading to Oslo but got a ride to drammen instantly
Summer night 1am, it was not much traffic, but the landscape is amazing and the spot is worth enough

Going to the North, good spot to stand with a small sidewalk, good stream of slow driving cars.
two gasstations nearby.
Good spot to get the ferry and possibly further
I was walking and I lifted my thumb up at the first car, they stopped and dropped me on a good spot on the main road to Trondheim.
Got a direct ride to Kristiansund, you can also easily get Trondheim from here. Better with a sign, people who will go same destination will stop.
Good spot to get the ferry
Lots of people passing by,  we were going to Ås center.
Just started walking out and the second car to pass stopped. People should have sympathy because it's a steep hill

Deep winter, heavy snowstorm, pitch black. After walking 7km from Hillesoy, I started hitchhiking at this junction (direction Tromso) in the middle of nowhere, as I would catch the traffic from Brensholmen as well. Take care, as there are zero lamp posts here. Got a ride after 30min halfway to Tromso! Enjoy the ride! :]
Good spot if heading to Pulpit Rock. Nice spot go pull over just before the tunnel.
Tried to get a ride from here to Lofoten. There was a lot of traffic, but everyone that stopped was headed to Harstad. First car to Harstad was within 10 min.
We got a ride to Svolvær, pretty good! :)
Good spot to go south, got a ride to a gas station  along the highway 2 km S from Moss.

I think this is the bust stop somebody is talking about in the other spot just south of this. 

There is indeed a nice bus stop, but it seems the tunnel will be open quite soon (I was here in June 2014), so this spot will get much less traffic.

Kirkines - You may be stuck here for a while after you get off the Hurtingen. If you are planning to go to Finland in winter, the only bus to you can catch comes at 17:35 outside the shopping centre where there are other buses and takes you to Tana Bru, where you have an overnight stay at the bus station to catch the 03:30 bus.

I loved every second of my dull experience standing outside for 5 hours in the snow with frozen feet and drinking icy cold beer trying to get a ride to either Tana Bru o

Got a ride with the ferry : didn't have NOK and couldn't pay with card, so they let me on the boat for free. 
On the boat, I asked people and got a ride to Larvik

Good spot to go to Elverum.

Might be a good idea to take a ride from here to Myklagard, then go south. 

OR try out the onramp to E6 heading south - although I have never tried that one.
Good spot. Plenty of space for the cars to pull over. But they are already accelerating here. Stood with a sign for Oppdal and got a ride to Dombås.
OK spot! Some cars go fast, but there is space to stop.
Ride to Dombås in 5min. Decent condition.
Got a ride quickly, good spot to stand, slow cars :)

I didn't get here until late in the evening, so there wasn't that much traffic. I was stopped by one car earlier, but it was only going a short distance. Finally, a truck pulled up. The only better option is to walk and ask at a nearby gas station (I'm not a fan of that, though).
heavy traffic, gas station nearby, also place for pullover
Easy accessible but cars are going way to fast and the gas station was barley used (Wednesday around 10) so I left after about an hour.

Theres a lot of traffic so you will probably find a ride in the end wherever you will go. The problem is that the cars are first going pretty fast because its just on the highway (so better look for the cars going to the gas station) and second most of them are probably just going to the suburbs. I was lucky after 45 minutes though so cant complain!
tried two times for 1 h and 1/2, no way
I thought it's better to ask people than standing with a sign, so i did, but most of them were not positive:( eventually 2 guys gave me a ride to Tønsberg, but not too good experience
Local people didn't stop, everybody was going home, i waited until a lady from Tunisia passing through… it all depends on luck
Ride to Fauske, probably would be better to find some place on the other side of the city…
Bus stop and cars don´t go very fast. You can go to the E6 from there, or with some luck to road 17.
There were no trucks
Not a bad spot, plenty of cars, but most of them going short distance. Still, it's on the main road north towards Hamar and you can get there easily by public transport (stop Trosterudkrysset).

Arrive here by bus to go north. I instantly thought it was not ideal place so i look for a way to avoid E6, it seems that there is some good spot on the n°4 highway, accessible by public transport.

But after 5min a truck stop going to jessheim. So at the end maybe not that bad :)

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Otta.
Not too good spot. But I guess there are not many better ones in Oslo. You can't really catch cars on the highway. No place to stop and they go too fast. So you'd be left only with the cars leaving the petrol station. But the traffic isn't that small. I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem. A Polish guy stopped to talk to me, saying that he doesn't go too far. I asked him to take me 15 kms up no

Got offered rides in various directions, mostly local. Wanted to go north although was standing with a sign to Dombås which is a small city so people didn't recognize it. 

Got better results using thumb and asking people around. I got bored a little bit so took a ride to Skedsmokorset
A family from German picked me up, not very big space for car to pull over
There is not much space, but enough…

Very little space for cars to stop right after the roundabout, but some nice fellas stopped for me after 2 minutes and took me cca 5 km west outside the city, there was a much better spot for cars to stop.

Waited 1hour... And picked up by a metal singer quite reknown
Good place for a break with view on the fjord. From the HH point, look up, to the nice waterfalls
Good luck
Look which side cars come to gas station and ask the drivers. I wait 15 min. to get ride to Aurland
boat ride is beautiful!:) i hh to Bergen and it was fine
Petrol station. Good spot for hitching to Oslo, a lot of tourist passing. Take beautiful boat ride from Flam to Godvangen, it is so good! Than hitch to Oslo (Took us 8 hours to get there).

Edit: in August, after 11am it's dead
So take care about your hike to the north of north, it takes at least 4h, if you don't count the fact that the path could be a bog, and the time to enjoy the feeling of the north

Here is the place to hike to the real North Cape
Then it's not hard to go back, there are few cars but don't worry
If you hike the trail to Kvinskjdollen, it's quite easy to get a ride back, at least to Honningsvån, even in bad weather.
Fast traffic and may be difficult for cars to stop for you. Someone pulled in slightly further up after seeing me and wave me over, got an awesome ride all the way to Kristansand

Bus stop for hitching south. A bit too much traffic for my taste, though. This might be your spot if you want to hitch from Stavanger or Sandnes southwards. If you're leaving Stavanger you may need to take a bus or train Sandnes and then walk to here (5 km from the centre. Fares are expensive but you can often get away without a ticket especially by bus.
It's a bus stop, enough place, just wait with patience!! A nice polish man brought me to Porsgrunn!
No cars stopped
nice belgian man took us in his van, we rode with him 1.5h
Great spot just on the bus spot
I was waiting there in the morning when there were not so many cars but after half hour I catch a car to Lom
Stand in the green space between the lanes, there´s no space for you on the right side of the road.
Not easy to stop, but we caught a ride to Vagamo within 20 minutes.
An older lady took me to Lindenes fyr and then back to the main road to Stavanger.
took quite some time to get a ride to Mandal, but its a nice spot with a busstop for cars to pull over
Its not that good

a perfect spot to Stavanger. Honestly I don't find on the map where it is exactly, but somewhere here. If you come form Kristiansand, take the bus 40 from the Centrum and get off the stop called Mjåvann, and stay in the busstop. It't just perfect. Good traffic, place for cars to stop etc. I waited 2 minutes and got a direct ride to Stavanger. Be avare that the bus 40 runs once in an hour or weekends even less times. Check for the bus schedule: http://agder.websrv02.reiseinfo.no/AgderIISSTaticTab
Many traffic, late afternoon, everybody was heading home after work but nobody stopped, waited one hour until a Norwegian lady brought me to the ferry!
Good spot for getting to Oslo, Førde and deeper into Sogn og fjordene.
Waited less than 5 minutes, lots of traffic and enough space for the cars to stop
mostly local traffic
Bus stop right after the traffic lights
Nice place but not so busy. A friend who was going north picked us up after a hour waiting so that was not hitchhiking :)
Not very busy but nice place to hang out in and wait. Worth the wait!

A could place, but not what I wanted (as I was going north). I waited a minute or so and then the first guy stopped and wanted to give me a ride (.. but to Stockholm). 5 minutes after the same happened. So - if you want to go to Sweden or even Stockholm, this is an excellent spot

Was impossible for me to hitch a ride in the city of Alta (bus stops) or then at the Museum bus stop. So i decided to walk here. After 3 hours of waiting one car finaly stopped and took me all the way to Bjerkvik. Good spot overwise, plenty of space to stop. Near the Museum its a bit confusing because there is a turn to a museum and then the bus stop is made so a bus can turn around, so its quite tricky stopping there.

Waited here for maybe 2 hours to get a lift until 20 km forward. but 3 cars stopped during my waiting. which I think is good. enough space for cars to stop and see your face. I was walking from the city until here and I think worth  all the way.
Far too much local trafic. I got nothing  and waited at least 90 minutes
A bus stop. Going West towards Notodden/Bergen. Is between two round-about so cars are going slow. And a gas station behind. I had with skies and a big backpack and it to 10 min to get a hike.
I think there was too much local traffic here, i only got one offer to go a short distance.
nice place to hitchhike to odda. straight road with a bus stop. many cars on this road.
Way too fast from the highway, not very visible though a good place to stop. Had to buy a truck driver a drink to get a ride to someplace better

Afternoon, waiting time 80 mins, a 109km ride to Hamar, but I jumped off at a gaz station 20 km before Hamar, which is the best decision when you head up to Trondheim.
As I always say about this Shell Gaz station - be patient and friendly filter out short local rides if you go far north.

I love this Gas station, many cars stop there. I used a sign and my thumb. You should filter out short distance rides, just be patient and wait for a longer ride.
Heading to Trondheim, waiting time 30 mins, a 266 km ride to Otta.
The traffic was quite high despite the Christmas period. Got offered rides to the airport. After 2 hours of waiting got a ride to Lilllehammer
Arrived in August late on a saturday evening, 7PM. Tried for two hours for a ride north to Dal or Espa, then gave up and took a ride to the airport. Frequency was low. I talked to people.

A couple people who couldnt see the sign properly pulled over, but then weren't going to Tromsø. Most people ignored. You might have more luck hitching to the road junction further North then hitching again across to Tromsø. The bus to Tromsø does stop here, so it's a good spot to attempt if you've got nothing else to do.
No-one stopped people didn't seem nice. A lady in a van got me back to the station where there was an emergency bus going to absiko since there was a snow storm
A lot of traffic, need to wait a while tho

You are visible here from a decent distance and drivers have a bit more time to make a decision.
Note that there are no reasonable spots after this one if you want get north over the bridge

Dir: north, summer 
Seems like a good spot, waited two hours with no one stopping so I just took the last bus to tromsø. Although I did start at 2pm, would probably have better luck earlier.

2025 UPDATE: It's now an awefull spot. 

I believe they rebuild the road and there is no place to pull over anymore. 


It will eventually work thought, got a ride to Tromsø in 25". Staying  in the middle of the crossroad is an option, safer, but you get only the ppl coming from senja the.
We only waited 10 mins for a ride to Tromsø. Try on the road and asking people in the gas station.
Dir: South. Some cars pass by here, easy to pull over or to ask people in the gass station.
Dir: North. At least in the winter there is not a lot of room for cars to stop, but they do anyway. There is a gas station on 855.
A lot of local traffic I guess, but good possibilietes to pull over. Try to get a ride out of town.

Direction: south. If you spent the night in the Moholt student village or for some other reason are in this area, you might as well try to start from this highway entrance if you're going south. I have not tried it yet, but next time I will defenitely start from here before walking around for hours trying to find a better place (which you probably won't)
Not many cars, but second car stopped!
Not many cars, but second car stopped!
Good sum up from the previous Hitchhiker: good if you can ask on the ferry, i did, 3 ppl refuse, at the end i stand at the exit fro classic method and got a ride to Narvik.

Dir: north, summer.
I made the mistake of not asking for rides on the ferry. All traffic has to come through the ferry, meaning you have a shot at one boatload of cars every 45 mins. I got lucky and got a ride to Narvik, from the first ferry that came.

There is a cycle of person arrriving and leaving here. I don't know what's the best time, but i was there at 6pm and noone was leaving the place. 

Maybe 4 / 5pm is good, when people finish Galdopingen.
For me it was a good spot. Plenty of people stopping there and a man took me as far north as he was driving before he turned into his village.
Not a good spot at 7 am, lots of cars coming here are just going to shop and then back to the city. This gas station doesn’t seem to be used a lot by cars going up north

Sign : Drammen

To Drammen

Most of the people are going to the suburbs
I waited for at least an hour at the entrance to the gas station, but standing on this triangle at the exit got me a ride west fairly quickly
tried for 30min. many cars but no one stopped. took the train in the end
Going to Larvik, it was a bus stop and lots of people passing by

At night, switched strategies very often. First waiting at the gas station, then waiting next to road at the gas station (there was so much snow I was over a meter above the ground so it was a terrible spot) before ending here, were a van pulled up and brought me to Bodø, saving me from a night out in the cold as it was 20:30 and I still had 3 full hours to go til Bodø

Summer/ Dir North

Good spot by the gas station

Excellent spot, asked the basically only car there and he brought me over 3 hours up north (which was a very nice change considering how many cars I took to barely get halfway to Bodø). If you’re not that lucky you might have to wait a lot longer as there’s basically no cars

This a tiny town with nothing going on. Very light traffic, so we got stuck there for two days... BUT the gas station employees gave us food, the dumpster behind the store are full of food and there's a nice park you camp in and no one will bother you :)
There were not many cars in September, people going back mainly in the late afternoon. Maybe there are better chances on the main road.
The mountain trail starts here. Traffic is not intense (a car every 10-15 minutes)

The spot is a decent alternative when it's dark outside and no traffic at the gas station if someone is heading north. There is a lamp and a place where cars can easily pull over. The only issue is that cars go downhill so the driver doesn't have time to react after spotting you.

It was 6 am, during winter, dark outside and traffic was very low. Got a ride after 15 minutes of waiting to Berkåk although the driver had to turn back for me as he didn't have time to react in time.
Stood here for an hour going south to Oslo. A good spot going by an old gas station. So was just unlucky it took so long i think.
I stay here without sign and get ride to Lillehammer for 10 min.

Not a good place, there's not anymore place to pull over. We had luck, when we were going to the southern roundabout, a couple picked us up to Åsen on a random street. The comment from 2013 was right, not a good spot anymore. You could try your chance in the gas stations nearby.

Direction: north

I hitchhiked from here and it was pretty ok. There was a lot of space to pull out. But that's probably going to change soon as they are building new road there.
Good spot

I had a really changing time there trying to get north to Trondheim. talked to probably hundreds of people. No one want to take me except one offering me a ride two days later. Stood also at the McDonald's with a sign. A lot of people say there going south.
In the end I took the ride two days later.
Most people go south from this place, we needed to go north and got a ride after half an hour

Had no other alternative to ask people around there was no good spot and the temperature was quite low. 

After 4 hours got a ride to Dombås but it was 27.12 so most people were coming back from Christmas to south and it was hard to find someone with a no fully packed car

Going south towards Oslo. Taken to Hamar. Good steady flow of cars, not the best of places for cars to stop but none the less seemed the most suitable place in the area. There is a nearby petrol station.
this map might be old, because there is a slip-road to the E6 highway that goes north. so go there and a car will stop in no time.
Good place with plenty of space to stop, but had to wait for a while.
I asked the store owner for some free food. He´s a kinds guy a gave me some bread an chease
Waited here for a long time, most of the cars are families With full cars, finaly two ladies stopped after more than 2 hours
big empty parking lot in front of a little store. still took me a while to get a ride to the nearby odda... anxious locals
quite tiring spot for 3 guys trying to get to Bergen. in the end after ~3 hours 1 nice German girl took us to Honefoss. wasn't able to find better spot too, but... it worked

It's a petrol station, not very good spot if you are heading northeast. 
"Hitchhikable" only during a rush hours, then it's useless.
And if you come here in the afternoon during the rush hour out of town, maybe you'll be lucky just as I was and you'll get a ride in a cabriolet! :-D
Not a really good place but I wasn't able to find a better one ...

Direction: north (Lom), west (Bergen)

Here's an on ramp and a gas station nearby.

Quite good spot, cars have a lot of space to stop and you’re right after the road that goes into the city (careful of getting false hopes when seeing a car driving towards you and then seeing it turn right)
I just jumped out of the car and the other one pulled up! There's plenty of room to stop! Maybe I was just lucky, but I recommend it!

Direction: north

If you end up in this middle of nowhere just like me, then here is enough place to pull off for the drivers. Though otherwise it is a terrible spot.
There is a lot of space to pull over. Most tourists vehicles are pretty packed though. Pretty windy and cold, at least when I was there.

The ferry is 170NOK for a car, same with 1 or 4 passenger
But if you go by foot they may take you 50NOK

It's some kind of wide side of the road (easy and safe to stop for the driver). we hiked from here to Jorpeland, seems an average place because there is traffic only when the ferry from Lauvvik comes to Oanes (every 20-25 minutes).
It took us 40-45 minutes to get the ride to Jorpeland.
It is Norway! Change country
Good place with some space for cars to pull over, traffic lights and people coming back from the airport. Gas station not far also. Bus 1 go near the place.
From Bodo towards E-6. For a guy and a girl - unexpectedly easy, for two guys - hard.

They go fast and downhill, but a lot of hikers and tourists (German and Dutch) so it's easy to get rides. There's also a tesla charger at the hutte, but not very crowded. Got directly to Lillehammer from here, no sign, just thumb in the road.
It worked well for us, a girl and a boy. Cars go fast, but a lot of space to pull over.
It is cold in the winter and cars go fast - but in the summer and on weekends there might be many tourists and the traffic slower.
Went there because it was marked here. Didn't see any place where a car could stop. Walked 4km south to a rest area and got a ride immediately there.
Decent spot, didn't have to wait long to get south!
The spot is not usable anymore, because of construction. Gas station is gone
very good spot!!!
A place where you can get some cars towards south (E18). Gas station.
Cars are not too fast, all right.

It was quite easy to find a ride +200 km south. 
Free wifi at some petrol station and/or café.
Waited 4 hours to get a lift North to Trondheim. Much of the traffic going west and south.
Ask the truckers if you want to go south (Oslo) or west (Ã…lesund). No trucks will go North/East towards Oppdal.
I agree with Anders, the place a km west is better. I tried this once, and I got to Drammen after 30 minutes by asking at the gasstation, so it is possible though.
The spot a kilometre or so further westwards down the road is much better. Just take the bus one more stop.
Going westwards can be quite difficult. This is the best place I know of.

I was there afternoon at Monday. Tried around 40 minutes and just one car stopped, which was the wrong direction for me. I tried to reach Oslo. Then just a local worker was going home and gave me a lift. I Stayed before the bridge because of workers from parking didn’t allowed me to stay under the bridge or after. Couple of days after one friend of mine also tried spot for 30 minutes and didn’t have like. But another friend tried once and it was successful for him. To Oslo too. So looks like not

Only one parking lot feeds into here as far as I can tell. That's fine if you wanna go to Oslo, since many cars go there. For going north this may be a problem. There is a speed bump, so cars have to go slower. And it is below a bridge, so you're safe from the rain. 
I tried for 10min on a saturday evening in August, 1900. The norwegian public holidays ended this weekend. 
I found the frequency somewhat low. So I only tried for ten minutes and then left.
Yeah bro Norway is a terrible country to hitchhack
Its an ok spot. Better off directly asking for rides at the gas statiom nearby honestly but everyone looked dour there. Got a short ride and refused a 3km jump out of fear of getting stranded again

Bad spot. Traffic here is fast and drivers have just few secons between a momement when they emerges from the road turn and a moment when a side lane turning markup is ending

Here are two options: (1) asking for gas station clents for pucking you up, (2) use a buss stop next to the station and try your luck in another spot (transport tickets a zonal by which you can reach out of the city and filter out the local traffic)

Gas station on the highway, hitched here two times, both times in the morning. Most of the people are going to Trondheim, sometimes there are tourists going more south. Both times got a lift to Klett (intersection with E39) and hitched south from there. Very friendly staff even suggested a trucker to take me along, and so he did towards Klett.
There wasn’t much space to pull over, but I got a very short ride within 5 minutes, which was very convenient
Not much space to stop, was just trying to get in the E18. Not good for getting in the E6 I think.
Male&female, waited for more than an hour. One car stopped but didn't take us(he went to the Torp)

A decent spot as it is possible to catch a ride both from the gas station and street. 

I recommend to have a sign since some cars go West. Got a ride straight to Oslo after 40 minutes of waiting

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Geiranger.
A good spot. A bus stop at a small road. But it didn't work. I guess it was due to fact it was late in the evening.  I started after 19:00 and gave up at 20:30. 
I the morning, the next day, I tried again at a similar bus stop, one km down the road and I got a ride after 20 minutes.
Very little traffic. We went to another place

Bus stop at the entry of the highway.
No sign
10 min
Light rain and windy
Not too many cars and pretty fast speeds but there's a bus stop for both directions.
Got a ride to Oppdal, the place is ok to stand, just a road exit tho.Good flow of cars, but they're going quite fast.
Got a ride to Oppdal, its a road exit to stand at so not the best spot, but cars can pull over nicely. Good flow of cars but they're going quite fast.
Going to oslo, found a ride in 15 mins, Lots of people passing by
I wanted to go to Kristiansand. Couldn't find a better spot than this
Fairly center, walked over more north to the opposite direction of a gas station, around "Mellavegen", there I got a ride to Alta after one hour waiting
It was Saturday morning and the traffic extremely low.

Summer/ Dir Hetta

Not much traffic, mostly locals going to Finland to buy cheaper Alcohol

Summer/ Dir Narvik

Not alot of space for cars to stop, but a lot of traffic!
Not a lot of traffic in the evening. Otherwise pretty okay I suppose.
Cars are rather fast, but I got picked up directly.
It is all right.
Not the best spot. Cars are relatively fast. More chances with the ones coming from the village.
Good spot to get further. A lot of space, but just little traffic.
Bus stop, people can easily pull over. We used it to get into the city.
Good spot to get out of Alta. Maybe you should prepare a sign like "out of town or further".
Not a lot of traffic (story of the north), but it is all right.
Not too much space to stop but there's not much traffic so it's okay. Got a ride to Sandnes during a pouring rain!
Pit stop on top of the mountain. Admire the view and try to catch a ride here (both directions).
A long lay-by for hitching north.
Got a ride all the way to Telemark from here!
Bad place - at least in the dark. There is a gas station but not too many who drive south use it.
This spot is actually good. There's some room to pull over, but the traffic heavily depends on the weather (dir south)
the speed here is rather high, lots mosquitos, not really much traffic
A Sos pocket and it, was not easy walking here, and the cars where driving fast. Took me 30 minutes going north.
This gas station is not very busy, but we got pretty far after 1,5h :) just ask everyone.
Dir: South. Jumped out of the previous car and before takign of the backpack our next car was there and drove us straight to Trondheim.
Dir: South. Just a place on the highway where people need some good will to pull over. There was some event happening here when we were here, otherwise the parking lot could be used to pull over.
caught a ride here to Ramberg, with local couple.

caught a ride here to Skoldjen.
waited about 1hr

Two options: go to the gas station, just west of here, but the traffic there goes both directions, or wait right at the end of the bridge if you want to go west. Not  a great spot but it worked for me. Got a quick ride in the rain to Sandnes!
On the roundabout right at the "no pedestrians" sign. Not a great spot due to little space to stop but it worked. Got a good ride in maybe half an hour to Moi.

This isn't a proper spot but maybe I just got lucky. There's very little space to stop and drivers see you a bit too late. However, one of the first cars stopped, but the ride wasn't good, so I continued and fairly soon got a ride to Arendal, dinner included!!
Going to E6 South. Not so bad spot with some cars coming from the city, and space for cars already on the E6 to pull over if the traffic is not too dense.
There is not much space for cars to stop, but there is a lot of slow traffic and almost everybody is going west on the e39 towards Stavanger.
There's a small place to stop for the South but this road is good for booth ways but not so many space to stop for the North :)
Used spot twice, okey spot.
In the center, direction Kaupangr. There is a busstop where cars can stop. Travic drives not really fast so they have time to decide.
Took 15min for me
Good spot for Southward traffic with plenty of place for the cars to stop. Getting a ride took long though.

Southward. Fairly long slip lane, though the traffic is busy and the speed is pretty high. Got a ride to Moss in maybe 20 mins by a guy who picked me up because according to him I was in a bad spot so he wanted to save me.
Friendly people in this town and really uplifting reactions (many people cheering with huge smiles). But strangely took a while to get picked up.
People go slow here right after the roundabout.
Can stand on the pavement to avoid fast traffic on the E39.
Heading north. Taken close to Dombås.
Picked up by an A-OK German guy. Loved his vibes, super chill man heading out east to Åndalsnes. Took a while to receive this ride, but well worth it of course.

A fairly grievous encounter with the elements. Tried to hitch as it was getting dark, with around 5 degrees Celsius and pouring rain. Very wet and cold thumb!!! Had to abort mission after an hour of attempting and head to base camp (the tent) for the night. Everybody seemed to be in a rush (something to do with Friday night?) What a relief the next morning when the sun was out. Much better circumstances. Waiting time the next morning was about 25 minutes.
after about an hour on a sunday morning i got a hitch to the E6 heading south

From Bodö directn south. Weekday, 9am. Got a lift to University (Mörkved) easily.. but mostly its local traffic, people going to work. It is worth taking the bus or train (1 stop) to Mörkved and hitch from there

Roundabout where road 17 heads off. Not much space to stop but cars go slowly. Fine in summer, don't try this in wintertime because there is not much traffic and tourists usually don't take up somebody.
right after roundabout. Not the best place, but there is no better.
The car that picked us up was going to Lakselv (ca. 300 km)
You can be sure that cars are driving a long way, but you have to wait.
Cars are driving fast here.
Not much space to pull over, but we were extremely lucky.
Direction North.
You're not very visible here, but people are still helpful.
Got stranded there. But it was at 11pm at night. The next morning i got a lift pretty quickly.
Small parking lot near the tunnel exit.
We were just lucky to get a ride here.
direction centre
Cars have a place where to stop (both way), but not much traffic.

Direction Bergen
Took about an hour and half to get a lift. Cars pass very fast.
There is a resting area, but noone use it. Cars pass very fast, about 80 km/h. It took about an hour to got a lift towards east.
short distance only
not that easy but possible, road is rather narrow, try to find somewhere could put over
A good bus stop where cars can stop. But most of the people won't go far.

Cars can stop easily and they go slow just after the roundabout. But most of them won't go far. Anyway, keep smiling and accept even short rides (the more you're out of Tronhdeim, the better chances you'll have to get a long ride).
I'm not sure how bad is this spot because I was lucky (the first car stopped). You can try to wait opposite the gas station at the beginning of this road (500 meters south from here).
Spot to wait on the way north to Gaupne / Luster / Lom. Cars have plenty of space to stop but it's a bit tricky / dangerous because just after a curve so they will see at the last moment.
Very low ammount of cars, but the percentage of stopping cars is high. The half of them is going to Odda (551) and the others take (107)
There is a bus stop and most of the cars are going to Skibotn or further
This is a good place to hitchhike to Finland since a lot of norwegian are going to shopping in Kilpisjärvi
Direction South... quiet road... too quiet

If you are stuck here in Winter waiting for the 03:30 bus into Finland, go to the Bus/Taxi stop which is located in a little street just after 'Indre Finnmark tingrett' (Museum) and on the opposite side of MIX (supermarket/shop)
I wanted to go North here, but gave up after 2 hours. Than going back south to Utsjoki, I had a ride after 15 minutes. It was in winter time.
Yes, ask cars on the ferry, We tried this with 4 people, all got a ride :)

if you just got off the ferry and you were too shy to ask directly on the ferry, rush out and try to hitch the cars getting off the ferry. It doesn't look like a great spot because car will be in a rush to get out and won't easily stop, but still they go not fast and they see you. We got a lift to Preikestolen area from here quite easily, but I recommend trying to talk with drivers in advance, while getting on the ferry, or just before getting off. In case you're not lucky with cars getting off
Myklegard is a petrol station and hotel. Try to avoid it if possible bed ppl drive very fast there (70 or 90) and don't easily stop
not really to much places where to hitchhike. not even that much traffic.
some kind of a parking lot. nice place with a great view to the other side of the fjord.
Good spot, cars going slowly round corner and bridge. But Little traffic going long distances.
no to many chance if only you are very lucky... the cars are going anywhere very slow here... and a small place to stop.
I had to wait quite a while, and only got a ride to Svindesund, which is not very far away. I think a lot of traffic is only going to the shopping malls across the boarder.
A lot of cars but I had to wait 30 min...
Bus stop. A lot of cars pass for this road but I had to wait 30 min.
it's a tough one cause there's still a lot of local traffic, but a lot of cars passing by and def a good spot for cars to stop safely.

Direction: south

To get south out of Stavanger is pretty hard but you can try also this bus station - it worked for me ... though there is lot of locals going to the city, it's on the E 39, so there are also people going through Stavanger more south ...
I was just incredibly lucky with one wonderful rock-girl in pink small car who turned on the next exit and got back for me to take me out of here ... :-)))

Direction: south

There's a bus station lane right next to the "highway", where cars can stop without problem, but they are driving really fast here and so are not much likely to stop though they see you miles before ...

Direction: everywhere

Or you can try this petrol station which is enough big even for trucks.

(in winter) There's not much traffic here going to Tromso, but the ferry arrives every 2 or 3 hours with new cars that are most likely to head there. Waited 6 hours till a car coming from the ferry took me directly to Tromso. You can stand at the petrol station, many cars pull over to ask them directly and its right next to the road to hold a sign, cars drive at normal speed, when you see the ferry coming you can go to the dock and stand right there as cars come out off the boat. There are dumps

It might look as a good place to hitch back to Stavanger after Kjerag, and in fact it is not bad: plenty of cars stopping to get some food... only problem is most are local traffic and/or full and anyway despite being a good place there's a better one just few kms westernmost.. so get even a very shortlift 'itll the junction with the road to stavanger, as there you'll get some more traffic (ie: cars coming from west) and more filtered to your destination.

Go out from the richest city in Norway is not easy! So get ready to wait! It seems a bad place, but its better for you to wait in the entrance of the highway than keep trying in other places were people is just moving arround the city. 20´!

This seems like a reasonable spot to go north, but in my experience cars here go too fast and the bus stop which could be a could place for cars to stop is behind a small curve so not very visible. Wasted 30 mins here, then decided to walk a bit further north... less than 5 mins walking there's another and much better spot still at the bus stop.
If you need get out of city the good one and not far away spot is at next side of the street at place where is Slottetsmuseet - you can easily ask every body. Just 10 minutes from centre.
nice busstop along the road. got a ride to utne to catch the ferry in average time
it's really hard to get out of oslo. i think this is the only spot where you can stop a car when going north.
It's hard to get out of Oslo - but after a couple of miles walking i found this place and somebody stopped and took me to a gas station further out from where everything went fine. I was going north.
Dir North. Fauske is the last Trainstation on this railroad (exept Bodø which is west) and containers from the trains are shifted to trucks here. you might find a ride later in the day.

Not to much southgoing traffic around 10 in the morning, i gave up after half an hour and walked further south

edit: i passed this place on a friday afternoon around 4pm and it was full of southgoing traffic! i guess it very much depends on the time, Many people work in Trondheim but live outside the city, or, on a friday, are on the way to a weekend-trip.
This is where the trucks get loaded. You can ask the drivers for a ride.
Difficult road to manage a place for a car to stop and get out of this area

Direction North. Parking lot, so perfect for cars to stop. The view is great. You can see a mountain which is called "the sleeping soldier" - it looks like a face with a helmet. Unfortunately we had plenty of time looking at him in the rain. But traffic was ok, so bad look, i guess.

To Nordkapp, you just need to wait in this general area... one tourist might take you at some point.
(PS: The E69 doesn't have a shoulder to walk further North after the Airfield).
its unbeleivable, but i somehow managed to get a lift from the end of the road A i Lofoten north, i had to change a couple of times, so what.
all thraffic coming from the ferry, so make sure you get to know the ferry schedule before you start. Walk up to the small supermarket and stand there by the road. I had to wait about 40mins
I gave up pretty quickly, as we were 3 ppl, but alone it should be possible, lots of traffic
Going to Oslo, this is a OK spot just outside Skien.
I saw it like the only place where car can stop on the right side, but they go fast and it's not ideal. But actually somehow it took 3min for me

I mean, kinda? It worked? Not the best though, cos people drive a bit fast. You’re very visible though. Got a ride with a guy going to Hamar, but he went out of his way and dropped me outside of Elverum - cool beans!
Seems like a perfect spot, all good conditions to go north. But after 35min without result I choose to take a bus to Narvik, and try again from there.
Bad spot. I wanted to go north, but there is a tunnel and barely any wakable area. So i was stuck here. I was lucky and took the first ride to As, the next village with better condition.
I would say it's a decent spot for going west but there are to exits to the same highway, dividing the traffic.
A guy and a girl on a Thursday at noon without a sign. There is some limited place to stop, and people go quite fast, but it's still ok. We got a ride to Førde.

A guy and a girl on a Tuesday afternoon without a sign. There is some place to stop, but not many cars, and most people just drive by. The people who stopped were all going to Stryn, so maybe not the best way to Nordfjordeid or Bergen...

A guy and a girl on a Tuesday afternoon, without a sign. Not a lot of space to stop here, and not that many cars go by. We got a ride to Grodås, but we were told this is not the best way to Bergen, as more people take the ferry here.

A guy and a girl on a Tuesday afternoon without a sign. We wanted to go south after leaving the ferry, but you have to wait about 20min for each passage of the ferry, so if you don't get lucky, it's a long wait...
Yet, we got a ride in the Party Car at the second ferry !
Asked around for my ride. Not a good spot to stick your thumb out on the side of the road
A guy and a girl on a Saturday at noon, without a sign. There is enough space for cars to stop, but the cars go quite fast here.
A guy and a girl on a Wednesday afternoon without a sign. There's a bus stop for cars to stop, but cars go a little fast. We were taken to the gas station of Vik.
Only little traffic to Sweden in the evening, but I got lucky with a tow truck
Good spot going to Oslo direction.

The spot is nice, everyone is going to the highway, but not so many cars here (but I've been there Sunday afternoon) and most of them seemed to go only short distances. Finally, I got a ride nearly to Hamar, but waited hour and a half.
Lot of space to stop and good visibility, but little traffic
Space to stop in the roundabout just before the exit for Stockholm. Easy to catch local rides, not good for going far.
A bit cold and wet, as the rain and the sun were so much cooler here. But eventually stopped a German caravan.
Not too much traffic, but a guy had time and took me to Isane ferjekai.

This gas station in general wasn't the best. Lots of cars, but a lot of locals, thumbs down, bad faces, beeps. Would not recommend. We tried asking in the gas station, in the ev chargers, and then thumbing in the bus stop inside. None worked well. Ended up in this spot, on the slip road direction Oslo. Small space on the side, not that easy to stop as they go quite fast already. A local bus ended up stopping for us (in the middle of the road) and taking us to Moelv.
Space to pull over but only ferry traffic that doesn't go far in the evening (plus the route goes only during summer)
Not great spot, but d'évent enough to find a ride to the highway gastation.
Very busy gas station but took a bit longer since I someone changed their mind while charging ... August 2025
Unfortunately there is no better spot if you want to hitchhike to Kongsberg :/ Very unfriendly, cold and also rude people
theres a bit of wider road (not sure why), so thats not technically a bus stop, but cars can stop here safely. a guy took us to oslo

Trying to get to Horten ferry, sign saying "Ferry". I think the other exit (34) is better if you're coming from the highway to the ferry, as most of the cars will take it, but got a ride easily with a Swiss couple in their 40 y.o. caravan.
The spot itself is ok but we gave up after 1h and walked to the  next onramp further south. Maybe a 10km sign is a good idea to get at least to one of the better spots.

Good spot, space to stop on the side of the road, they still go slow. Had to wait three rounds of ferry to get a car, so not the best in that regard. Tried with and without sign, should be easier to go south in the highway.
visibility good, speed okish, only place for cars to stop is on the lane leaving the road (still possible without blocking it).
Nice old couple
not that many cars in the afternoon someone told me there are more in the morning, I got a ride to Alta, a lot motorbikes someone offered me a ride but i didnt have a helmet
Cars are from the ferry... it's better to ask them in the ferry, they won't stop... still a couple from Italy picked me up here
A Finnish took me to Odda after standing in the rain for one hour,.. the wind was super strong and cold
Travelled to Vågsboten, en route to Vossevangen. I held up a sign saying 'IKEA', which is on the same route.
Not the best place but if your headed south its beter than on the other side of the roundabout

Was walking towards Nybyen and found a car willing to take me there. Not the best thing to hitchhike in this small town because there’s not a lot of places people can want to go to and the probability that the one car driving would be willing to pick you up is quite low
Guy needed to go to the airport so he dropped me here. Not a good spot and it was raining but I got lucky and got brought a bit further
People took pity out of me because I was hitchhiking in the dark (always were reflective vests, for safety and that way Norwegians will be more enclosed to help you out)

When I was bored I would hitchhike around to visit the Lofoten. When staying in Leknes I would always stand at the roundabout, which was a pretty good spot, but the locals are just very tired of tourists so maybe that’s why the pick up time isn’t crazy great

Switched between standing here (in the dark with a bunch of flashy vests to be very visible as it can be a dangerous spot) and asking at the gas station (I really had a curse going on nobody needed to go north)

I first tried for too long at the gas station right next to this place before deciding to move a bit further on the road. Found this « looking like a bus stop » strip of road where a truck managed to stop at to pick me up a bit further up the road
Not a very good spot as there’s a lot of cars blocking the cars behind them to see you. If you go up and ask them when it’s red it might work better
I believe this gas station is a good spot to go to Bergen, I managed to find a car going up north but it didn’t bring me far
At the bus stop, seems to be a good place but I feel like I got lucky. Got dropped off at the ferry higher north on this road

I believe this is a good spot if you want to either join the E6 or the E18 as was my case. The only problem would be the city mentality (people don’t have the time to take you hitchhiking) and the fact that Norwegians aren’t very keen on hitchhiking (in the south at least)
First tried standing at the roundabout but had no luck. Decided to go on the parking and ask people and found a car pretty quickly

Good spot to hitchhike at a Busstop (Kvåle). Got a Ride to Bergen super quick. The downside is that the spot is not super accessible. A friend drove me to the Busstop from Voss and then I started hitching from there. I guess it is an Option to walk from Voss via Peter Bondes Veg and then following the little paved road right next to E16 (probs 30-40 min walk). There is another Busstop closer to Voss (Seim) that is less far to walk but I have not tried hitching a ride from there. 

**for Refere

Even though this is pretty much out in nowhere i got a ride pretty quick with some tourists. Since Lysebotn/Kjerag is quite a popular touristy spot during summerseason, i think it might be quite ok to get a ride then, probably not so easy during off-season. For me it was mid-September so quite late in the season. I just stood at the intersection - it‘s quide qide and you can easily stand to the side w/out any danger and still be seen well when cars take the exit.
In direction of Stavanger there is no place to stand after the roundabout, so we had to wait at the exit of gas station.

Technically not a bad spot, but it is more convenient to walk to Ler and get a ride there. After 25 minutes a got a ride, the car was going to the national park, but I decided to get off at Lundamo, which was more convenient for me.

I tried some busstops in alta for an hour but nobody would stop and they all seemed to think it was hilarious. Eventually got the bus here (saga stop). Found a driveway with some space and thumbed. Traffic was slow good visibility, legend tourists eventually stopped and took me to nordkapp, but after an hour. it kinda felt harder than it had any right to be.
Not the best Spot, as not much traffic. If possible try to hitch a direct ride Honnigsvåg - Nordkapp in both directions
A lot of traffic but waited for quite long. Going to Sweden
Don't remember the exact spot but a break spot somewhere here. High speeds but otherwise good. Got lucky in 10 minutes.
Not the best spot but very scenic. Somewhat fast speeds and not too much room to stop. Still works.
