Not a perfect spot, but good enough and safe (!) - enough space to stop for a car. Waited for 50 mins, got a ride to Dombås.
Not so busy, we were standing with a Brønnøysund/Bodø sign. After 1h30 we got a ride to Skogmo.
Many people coming and going, mostly local trafic tho, got a ride south to Ulsberg.

Dir: Hauge i Dalane
Very quickly I was picked up by a couple of tourists from France, but I was rather lucky.

Dir: north, summer. 
Rest stop off the e6, toilets and shelter, also a bus stop in case you get very unlucky. I got lucky and the first people I asked gave me a ride to bognes ferry terminal. Not really anywhere to stand on E6 so only hope is to ask people who pull in.
Ok spot to stand, good flow of cars, sometimes quite fast tho. Theres also a Gasstation where you can ask the people. Got a ride north to Lillehammer.
Not much space to stop after the roundabout, but lots of cars. You can also approach people at the gas station. Got a ride to Oslo after 30 min
Going south, got a ride to Oslo, bad/risky spot to stand, the cars are going fast, but can stop relatively well. Also konda tricky to walk to.
Bus stop on the way onto the highway, lots of space to pull over but barely any traffic on a Sunday.

Not as good as I would've thought.
Almost all traffic goes towards bergen and has to slow down up the hill.
Still took me 2 - 2.5 hours to get picked up BUT they drove me all the way to Bergen and even let me sleep in their house for the night! Great people much love xx
Roadworks happening at the time which helped as there was temporary traffic lights. I think I was lucky

I Was heading south from that point an waited about an 1 Hour. Problem is that the next small Sight is about 20 min  by car so a lot to walk. But there i a grosery store wich gave me some food for free!

Somewhere on this road, but I don't know where exactly, there is a small supermarket with lots of place to stop for cars. It's on your right side if you're coming from Tana and heading to Utsjoki. A truck stopped here for me. Not much traffic.
E 134 in Etne. I was standing somewhere over here, at a bus stop in front of a big shopping center. After 1 hour, I got a ride to Karlstad, Sweden!
There is a parking with some maps. After 1 hour, I got a ride to stavanger

as of september 2012 the toll station is closed.
A Guy from Honningsvåg told me that they made the money they needed to pay for the tunnel and the toll station wont open again
it's a gasstation (shell)
Bad spot, 2,5 h waiting toward Bergen. Howewer there is no better one in that direction

Not a very good spot: not so much space at the side of the road for cars to stop. I waited there 2 hours on Sunday evening, without luck, then returned Monday morning to try again. I got lucky and got a ride in 55 minutes then, to Otta. However, don't know if there are any better spots around Lillehammer. The one further south doesn't look very well from reviews neither.
In June 2015 we gave up hitchhiking from this spot and had to take a train because of being in hurry.
not the best spot, but we didn\\'t have other option. there is enough room just for one car. so other cars have to stop and wait while you are getting in the car.
Agree with the other review. Lots of cars going out of the highway, nobody going in direction Sweden. Got a ride of a local to a bit further, in a place where cars could stop on the side of the road.
Waited ages on a weekday afternoon. Most people were leaving the highway, just few entering, many cars with only one extra seat.
On-ramp to E18 towards Stockholm.
Bus stop with cover from the rain. In my opinion its a good spot, waited here 30 minutes before getting a lift towards Verdalsora.

There is a curve that makes it harder for cars to stop. I was lucky because a villager felt sorry for me and gave me a ride to Steinkjer. In generell it does not look like a bad spot, but it feels like one.
Ride to Bognes in 55". Never wait that long usually, but I guess it's a ok spot.
I (male) waited 5 minutes just after the roundabout to get a ride south on a sunny july afternoon.
Dir: North. There are three Gas-stations in Fauske, at this cross road there are two. It didn't help me.
From Fauske in the direction of Narvik. Again, for a guy and a girl - 5 mins, but my two male friends spent dozen of hours trying to hh from Fauske.
Like the other guy said, not good, bu for me it actually works fine, in 2 minutes a got a ride to the next town.

Quite dangerous to stand here and responsible drivers will never stop here. I thankfully got a car that was willing to stop recklessly there and I’m very grateful, but wouldn’t recommend this spot. People at the gas station were going south AGAIN
Bus stop, the best spot on this road, but only norvegians cars, so i waited 1hour and go to the other road
this road is better than the one above, more space to stop and seemingly more traffic. go here for getting back to E6
Too much traffic and very little place to stop.
incredibly, four of us waited about twenty minutes for two rides to the next gas station. It's really not a great spot, there's a lot of traffic and no stopping space at all.

yes, not very good, cars on the road fast speed, it depends on the cars in the petrol station..but with patience.. still can make it :), picked up by a norwegian couple who were going to shop in Sweden

Try not to get dropped here, there's nowhere to stand on the road, so you'd have to wait at the gas station and ask everyone that pulls in, also i walked about an hour north on a local road to find somewhere to pitch a tent, only giving it two stars because there's a coop here aswell.

First I waited at the bus station before this petrol station, it was small rain, but nobody stopped, and I changed to this petrol station, it didn't work, so i decided to walk forward and saw what would happen, and luckily, a Swedish lady and Argentine man picked me up after 3 hours !!!
Dangerous spot wouldn’t recommend. I switched between standing there and asking cars who stopped at the gas station, and that’s how I found my next car

My last ride let me out here and I just couldn't get any further from here.. I waited for over two hours while there was lots of traffic, but there really is no place for a car to stop at all. Also they are kinda distracted going through the roundabout so they don't really notice you. Not a good spot in my opinion. I would rather go a little further away from the highway and try hitchhiking on the nearest bus stop even though there is a little less traffic.
Got luck, a couple from USA and Brasil passed by..
on the other side of the road is a bus stop or similar. I stood there, cars could easily pull over there as well. On the right hand side of the road is not a lot of space to pull over I think.
Are you sure it was Trofors at E6? Because Mosjöen is further north..
Waited there for 24 hours (incl. short sleep in the tent by the road) in January 2002.
Waited there for 24 hours in January 2002 /sigurdas
Not the quickest wait or the best spot even though it seema like a fine spot. Still works alright. I stood on the small grass isle next to the crosswalk and got a ride a bit further down the road.
Carpark for the Alta sculpture museum. Waited here 6 hours in total. Looks like a good spot with space for drivers to stop, maybe I was just unlucky.

Waited for 2,5 hours. Then gave up, started walking towards a other spot but over estimated the distance. Then decided to take the bus to Sogndal since it was 4 hours before sunset and it is 5 hours nonstop driving. (didn't had a sign)
Busstop direction Gol, in principle cars have enough time to see you and stop.

Senseless. Barely cars go this direction. Not many grounds for car to pull by as well cuz it's just an entrance to the highway. Stay here back and forth for 3 hours try to get a ride down south but no luck. Take a bus instead to Gothenburg with €5.

Try to avoid it if you get a ride to Sarpsborg get off to gas station before driving up to the exit, it will help
Not the best place, so avoid it if you can, but it can still work of course
Southward traffic. Two hours to get a ride, hardly any space for cars to stop. Avoid it if you can. Try the other spot in Sarpsborg.
Don't recommend this spot. Head up 200m to Skedsmokorset Shell Gas station, which is a perfect spot, just be patient.

August, Saturday evening 7PM. Aside from the gas station, I tried this spot to get to Dal or Espa, north on E6. I tried for about 20min. 
One local advised me that that was pointless, there's only local traffic. 
I got a ride to the airport which passed Jessheim petrol station with a friendly Californian who was listening to Nujabes (big plus).

Used this spot to get out of the hitchgathering 2016 together with 2 other hitchhikers. It was raining and all 3 of us got picked up by a car in about 15-20 minutes. I agree that the place is not ideal: no good place for cars to stop although the roundabout is quite spacious and the cars can stop in the other edge of the roundabout without hindering traffic that much. They would have to act fast though.
Not too much space, a lot of trucks.

if you're dropped at the roundabout just north of this spot, you should either go here or to the pit stop regardless of your direction. You'll have to take any car that stops, no matter where it's going, just to get out of here.
Got a ride here in 30 mins. Not the best spot but it should work during the summer when there are plenty of tourists.
i tried to take the old scenic route to sandnes, but it was impossible.... only very few cars but nice norwegians who life only a few kilometers away and noone going on a long trip on this way.
Was going north going to Otta, not a got spot to find stood by the round a bout. No luck for 2 hours walked another place.

Came from the mountains down to this spot and we here going to Lillehammer. We stood here in 1,5 hours and 5 cars drove past us our way. Say yes to every ride you get. 7km down there road is there a tourist spot called helvete. When we got here, it was much easier getting a hike.

I was going towards  Oslo. And the one I got a ride with said that this should be a good gas station to get a ride from. But this was of the E6 and just a few local cars stopped there. I found a spot on the E6 with better luck

Dir: South. Getting finally out of Mo i Rana after spending the night we waited another hour in the momrning and then someone got us out of town and dropped us here. Almost no traffic passing by. The Bunnpriss (I think) had some food in their dumpsters.

Dir: South and North. Both ways I got stranded at this place. It is just awefull getting out of here. Heading South we arrived at 23 and North 17. On my way North I had to spend the night here since I gave up after 3 hours in the rain (both in winter) Try not to end up in Mo i Rana! The people at Best gass station are super friendly and let me sleep both ways in their shower
Very bad spot to get back to E6. We ended up walking 10 km to reach the spot at entrance 18 from Drøbak.

Difficult to hitch. Very low traffic. However mostly likely to be picked up by some Sami. (in my case director of Sami radio station so it was quite interesting). 

Hitch-hiking in Summer.
Wintertime to the South after a longer time someone will stop and take you from this sami shithole

Holy cow. After trying the petrol station down the road in Åndalsnes for around 2 hours with no fortune, came to this spot and then got a lift in 30 minutes. Extremely windy and cold with dampened spirits suddenly changed completely when a ride as far as Oslo was offered! Took a ride to Lillehammer though.
Do not bother walking here from A - the traffic is virtually the same.
Pointless spot to hitchhike direction west. Dead.

This place is really bad, be sure that you won't get dropped off here. Cars can't stop and you have to wait in the middle of the road/ramp otherwise cars arriving from south won't see you. I wanted to go north to Bergen and my driver was going east but I couldn't find someone else to pick me up. So I had to walk along the road up to the next bus stop...
yes, but it is only one possibility how to go to Kiruna direction. We stay about 4 hours in winter....
Direction East. Absolutely no traffic, after one hour the third car stopped. What to say?
there is a bus stop right out of the city. great place where to hitchhike. however not really to much cars passing by. we were here for the whole day. then we took a bus the next day to forde.
I was just lucky with one women who took me out of this terrible gas station ...

Direction: Everywhere

There's a petrol station where you can ask people to give you a ride, but not any good place to hitch from near the road.

Direction: north

A petrol station ... not a really good spot.
there is nothing but a camping ground a road and a ferryterminal and really not much traffic. 3rd car stopped but i still waited over half an hour
Dir. North. I waited forever, you increase your chances by walking to the next spot i pointed out.
It is very difficult to impossible to catch a ride along the E6 in Trondheim. The road has two lanes, cars go very fast and bus stops are separated from the road, so it's not easy to stop.

Waited about 30 minutes for a ride to Karlstad, which I think was ridiculously lucky. There's almost no cars going there, but unfortunately basically no alternative. Place was quite ok, there's a bus stop next to a gas station.
No place to stop
Old guy took me to a better spot. Going towards Sverige.

I wanted to go north. But I hitchike both direction as it's an awefull spot, place to stop but car are super fast and bad visibilty (for the one going north). I got a ride to fauske and start again from there.

A guy and a girl on a Friday at noon with a sign. We waited not that long at the exit to go south as there is no other good place to stop around, and a lot of people passing there seemed to go south too. Nobody stopped though, so we gave up, went to eat and contemplated taking a bus, but a nice guy came to us and said he was going to Ålgård and could get us out of here. If possible, try not to get here for hitchhiking...
Little place to stop, cars drive fast and don't see you after the curve
Quite a bad spot, as not many people were willing to stop here. Finally a German campervan stopped for me and offered some fruits and a warm ride until Kinsarvik.
Even though it's 50 and lots of traffic only one car stopped that would've taken me short distance only (August 2025)

Again, there's no good spot in this way out. Here they can stop on an exiting street, but cars go fast and close to each other, dangerous situation. We did end up getting two rides for 2+1 people one after the other. Still better go to a different place.
No place to stop. Got lucky. The bus stop is better, use a sign. I got a ride very fast by a hippie pentecostal father and his little son going to Kongsberg

Not a bad place for cars to stop, they have space on the bus stop. But it took us quite a while. Trying signs, no signs, other direction... With no luck. Finally a great soul picked us up and drove us an hour out of his way.
Roundabout, not good spot, but didn't find better space, a norwegian man picked me up after 1 hour waiting by luck and hope
Asked Someone on the ferry from the island. Got helped by a resident so might not be universal
tried to get one of the cars leaving the ferry. many cars but no one stopped.
Heading to Sand. Very few cars passing, but eventually got a lift from a local.
Hitchhiked back to Leknes around 6-7 pm while walking on the bridge
No cars were driving up north (AGAIN) and basically no cars in the parking lot. I thankfully intercepted an older couple leaving the restaurant who brought me a bit more north
Not the best spot, my biggest problem was the fact that people were going south and not north. Eventually I accepted a ride from a truck that barely brought me further north

Not a very good spot, at least this time of year the driveway is ice and hilly not much chance of anyone stopping for you. A kind later offered hot coffee and her home after seeing me standing there for a while
You can't stand directly on the E6 as there is no place for cars to stop, we stood on a side road. Mostly local traffic, we got a ride to Åsen eventually
Mostly local traffic or people that go to Oslo. We wanted to go north and got a ride to Minnesund after an hour. Not a recommendable spot if you want to go north
Very hard to hitchhike from here, almost got a car after 30 minutes but they said they weren’t going far. Started walking down the road and a van took me to the airport
Cars going fast and they can see you only for a few seconds. At least there is enough space. Not a great place, wish you luck!

In the evening again. From the bus top, lots of laughing morons, no rides. A lot of people where just going to the gas stations just to the north, if you want to avoid them walk a little furth to the next bustop
not much space to stop but who want, will stop. towards tromso quite a lot people, so it shouldn´t be a problem

We were walking to the next rest area (north) with our Bodø sign in sight. We were at the left of the road. Suddenly, a car stopped in the space a little bit further on the road, so we ran and the guy was going to Mo i Rana. That was just luck.
Nice spot but... no one is going that way. We walked south-west on the road to go to the gas station near the bridge. It's a way much better spot.
Not a really good spot because cars don't have space to pull out. There was not much traffic so it was okay. We got a ride to Kløfta, very close but in a better spot. 2 guys with a Trondheim sign.

Ot is better to ask people on the ferry, because after you go out, the crash don't want to stóp. Only opportunity is when cars are going from ferry further. In other case you need to wait 30 minute to next ferry.

Not the best spot to get in direction to Kautokeino,  all cars ride to the Nordkapp and people who drove in the direction more to the west (Kautokeino) didn't stop and don't understand hitchhiking. One guy from Switzerland saved us after 6 hours, he took us out of this Saami shithole back to Finland. However some people were offering us to ride with them to the north (Nordkapp) or Alta.

- One of the worst experience. At least stuff members on the gas station were nice and helpful. More than h
You can get here by the free bus to IKEA from Bergen city center, but you better walk a bit further east to a better spot
I didn't try this place because I think it's not okay. There's no place for cars to stop plus some people only go to the gas station then go back to the main road (road 5).

I'm not sur this is true
You have to pay only for the parking
And then it's 350 Nok if you want to enter the building, where there is a tiny museum, a coffee, restaurant, souvenir store, to use even oore money

If you stay in the car until nordkapp, as of 2024 they WILL charge you 17 NOK  (€1.50) per person in the car, on top of the car fee. If you need to avoid that, ask to get out here, at the nordkapp 500m sign, (it is invisivle from the ticket boots, but has not much space, so warn your driver in advance) and then walk off the road a few hundred metres to nordkapp (the terrain is fine/flat and you can see some cute reindeer). I made a beeline offtrail for just east of the children of the world scul
I try 15 min, but it's so bad, just walk 5" to the bus stop before the bridge.
bad spot, cars go fast, theres no place to stop safely
It is a bad spot to stand, cars can't stop very well but I got lucky and got a Ride ro Mo i Rana.
Not the best place to hitchhike, but my car stopped almost immediately. Maybe I was just lucky, but there's no better place to hitchhike north from Trondheim...
Don't hitchhike here if you're going back to mainland Norway. Most cars are only going to town and going back. You're better off walking to the other side of town and catch outbound traffic only.
No cars, no gas station, just in the middle of nowhere. We walked 6 kilometers up the road to the next gas station.
Forget this place. Cars come by fast, and there are annoying small mosquitoes

DONT HITCHHIKE HERE!
(summer 2014)
The whole roundabout is under huuuge construction, big mess, chaos. No spot where to hitchhike.
Worst hh ever! From Haugesund towards north (E-16). Two days spent trying until someone took us!
Few hours of waiting while the traffic wasn't the worst as for Norway and no-one stopped.
Space for stopping, but no good traffic. Gave up.

Don't let drivers drop you off here... No cars at all, specially not going towards Stockholm. Miscommunication with driver lead to his. I ended up having to ho up the highway and hitchhike in the off-ramp. Would not recommend, cars very fast, illegal.
Not a good spot to go south. No place to stop. In general all this exit (we walked to different places along the road) is infamous. Better go to a gas station directly instead of trying.
Local guy

it's a bus stop, enough space, but no one stopped, after 4 hours waiting( or maybe i should just walk to the tunnel entrance) a polish man picked me up and dropped at the roundabout before tunnel, because i was heading to Flam,
Trying to walk to Moskenes, and just a Polish lady stopped for me in the very early morning when it was empty on the road, i don't suggest here :)

I looked for a way to Preikestolen- needed to get on the road 13. No success at this Spot and directly infront of the Tunnel would be maybe too dangerous. Anyways I took a 4€ bus to Jørpeland. Then I just Need to get a ride to the Preikestolen Parking Spot. Hope I will have succes;)
The Tourist Bus that goes up to the parking Spot is by the way 35€- too expensive.
Although there is a bus stop people won’t stop easily
Cars won’t stop here when it’s dark as they don’t see/know there is a spot for them to stop at. They’re coming at great speed so careful here

Dont get dropped here!!! No one going on the E18 is going to quickly do a detour on this roundabout, most people arriving on this roundabout are going on the ferry and the few people leaving the ferry won’t take you. I got very lucky but I wouldn’t be hoping to be picked up here again
Lots of cars, but mostly local traffic. We had a sign with Mosjøen and Mo i Rana, no cars stopped. In the end we took a train there.
Cars cannot take that entrance to the highway. Had to take the bus 311 to Stjørdal to continue hitchhiking to the north

Shitty spot if you‘re trying to get to Bergen. Apparently it makes more sense to try on the other side of Voss before the Tunnel as almost nobody driving down that road goes to Bergen. Gave up after 1,5 hours and ended up taking the Train bc i had to be in Bergen at a certain time.

Terrible, terrible spot. No place to hitchhike and there is a lot of city traffic.
Get X39 bus to Ålgård as soon as possible.
This spot is not convenient at all (going south). Walk 15 minutes to a bus stop and try to get a ride there. Or walk 40 minutes to Ler, which is a good spot.

Technically OK, but 3 hours wait (from 1:30pm till 15.30 pm) on Saturday is a shit! Finally got a ride to Kvål, which is not a perfect spot at all. As soon as I got to my favorite spot LUNDAMO, I got a long ride after 10 minutes wait. 
Klet, sorry never ever! Please read my review about Lundamo and start your trip from there!

I spent almost 4,5 hours between this gas station and the ramp. Surprisingly I didn't get luck. There were even cars going to Copenhagen, but totally full, there is much local traffic there too. Then I came to the bus stop on the motorway and got a ride after 20 mins.

Even I got a ride after 5 mins, the spot in Rena is not really convenient. People going from the gas station and supermarked can see you, but it's not convenient for the cars going on the main road to pull over because of speed limit 70-80km/h and not enough space to pull out.
There is a bed here :-)

After more than 3 hours I accepted the first ride that took me somewhere between Lakselv and Karasjok. Don't be like me! Only accept rides to at least Karasjok. There is nothing in between. 

After 2 more hours in the middle of nowhere I hitched a ride back north, and took the route Alta->Kautokeino->Finland

Disclaimer: it was a sunday, so you might  be more lucky on a weekday.
Not a good spot. A lot of cars but too quick, there's not enough place to pull out. We walked 1,5km north to the rest area.
The spot itself is okay, but got nlucky on two consecutive days, had to start asking people at the Gasstation.
Just leave, just take the train one stop to sparbu, decent bus stop there. Here, there's just a kind of driveway to stand at, not really worth it when sparbu is so close by.
Not much space for cars to stop, no one stopped at all, but is a good traffic but only for few kilometres.
Bad spot to stand, good flow of cars tho, maybe I was unlucky. But theres two gasstations where you could ask the people (i'm not a fan of that).
Cars are going to fast, and the spot for them to hold is very small. Didn't get a ride, had to take the Bus.
I tried multiple bus stops along this road in the pouring rain with a sign that read oslo, and got nothing but an offer for a ride to a small village
Avoid this spot! I got a ride, but the cars go fast and there is no a proper place to stop there.

Very slow and local traffic. I had to stay a night after a failed attempt and waited hour the next. Got a lucky ride to Bergan from a Portuguese guy. Buses are once every two days so not a great place to be stuck!
